templategroup.name: CSS
templategroup.template:
BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

These CSS classes are for the attachment panel in the content entry UI. Specifically, just for a single attachment within the attachment panel as seen in the contententry_panel_attachments_item template.

{vb:phrase insert} {vb:phrase insert_image} {vb:phrase remove}
Example file with image thumbnail.png
{vb:phrase insert} {vb:phrase remove}
Example file with doc thumbnail.txt
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-attach-item { } .b-attach-item__thumb { /*border: 1px solid {vb:stylevar section_divider_color};*/ width: 35px; text-align: center; } .b-attach-item__image { max-height: 35px; max-width: 35px; margin: 0 auto; } .b-attach-item__controls { } .b-attach-item__filename { } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Primary button .b-button .b-button--primary

Regular button .b-button (and optionally .b-button--secondary)

File upload button: .b-button .b-button--upload (and other markup)

You can create a customized <input type="file"> interface by wrapping a tag with this class around the file input tag:

  1. 1. Create a file input tag with class b-form-input__file--hidden
  2. 2. Wrap it in a tag with class .b-button--upload (we recommend using an HTML <label> tag, because some browsers will register a click on the label as activating the contained file input tag.

Primary light button .b-button .b-button--primary-light

Special button .b-button .b-button--special

Pseudo-buttons -- buttons using a <span> or <a> element etc.

This is a <span> This is an <a> This is an <a> with no href

The same buttons in their disabled state

This is a <span> This is an <a> This is an <a> with no href

Note about pseudo buttons

When using a pseudo button (using the .b-button class on an element other than <button> or <input type="button">), it should always be accompanied by the .js-button class, which gives the pseudo button the same keyboard behavior as a real button, namely, you can use enter or spacebar to activate the button after tabbing to it. It should also be accompanied by a tabindex attribute set to 0 tabindex="0" to insert it into the keyboard navigation order of the page.

See also: css_b_link.css for pseudo links.

NOTE: There is no need to use .h-right or .h-left on the buttons or on the button group, in fact, using it will cause the buttons to not go full width in Responsive.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES ************************** Base button - When no other modifiers are applied, this looks the same as the secondary button. ************************** .b-button, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button { box-sizing: border-box; Inline block for buttons that are not inside a b-button-group display: inline-block; min-width: 65px; vertical-align: middle; border-radius: 2px; border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border}; text-align: center; font: {vb:stylevar button_font}; line-height: 1.6rem; padding: 0.4rem 1.2rem; background: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_background}; color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color}; } /* Override color applied to A elements */ .b-button:link, .b-button:visited, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button:link, .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button:visited { color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color}; } /* This block of overly specific rules overrides other rules with the same selectors (minus the .b-button) that was making button text blue. I'm using specificity to override them instead of !important. TODO: Once everything is converted to BEM and uses a single class we won't need these. */ .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:active, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:active, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:visited, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button:active, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button:hover, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button:hover, .ui-state-default a.b-button, .ui-state-default a.b-button:link, .ui-state-default a.b-button:visited, Also override the text decoration from a elements VBV-18349 a.b-button, a.b-button:link, a.b-button:visited { color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color}; text-decoration: none; } /* This block of overly specific rules overrides other rules with the same selectors (minus the .b-button) that was making button text blue. I'm using specificity to override them instead of !important. TODO: Once everything is converted to BEM and uses a single class we won't need these. */ .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:active, .profile-widget .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:active, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:active, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:hover, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-button.b-button--primary:hover, .ui-state-default a.b-button.b-button--primary, .ui-state-default a.b-button.b-button--primary:link, .ui-state-default a.b-button.b-button--primary:visited { color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_text_color}; text-decoration: none; } .b-button, .ui-widget .b-button, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button { Override jQuery UI's specific ui-widget button rules font: {vb:stylevar button_font}; } Override more jQuery UI's specific ui-widget button rules .ui-tabs .ui-tabs-nav .ui-tabs-anchor.b-button { padding: 0.4rem 1.2rem; } /* Default hover/focus state */ .b-button:focus, .b-button:hover { cursor: pointer; border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border_hover}; background: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_background_hover}; color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color_hover}; } ************************** Primary button -- White text on bright blue background ************************** .b-button--primary, .b-button--primary:link, .b-button--primary:visited, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--primary, .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--primary:link, .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--primary:visited { background: {vb:stylevar button_primary_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_text_color.color}; } .b-button--primary:focus, .b-button--primary:hover, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--primary:focus, .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--primary:hover { background: {vb:stylevar button_primary_background_hover}; border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_border_hover}; color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_text_color_hover.color}; } ************************** Primary light button -- Dark text on a light blue background ************************** .b-button--primary-light, .b-button--primary-light:link, .b-button--primary-light:visited { background: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_text_color.color}; } .b-button--primary-light:focus, .b-button--primary-light:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_border_hover}; background: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_background_hover}; color: {vb:stylevar button_primary_light_text_color_hover.color}; } ************************** Secondary button -- Dark text on light grey background ************************** .b-button--secondary, .b-button--secondary:link, .b-button--secondary:visited, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--secondary, .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--secondary:link, .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--secondary:visited { background: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color.color}; } Need to set the color for the span that is *inside* some ckeditor buttons. .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--secondary span { color: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_text_color.color}; } .b-button--secondary:focus, .b-button--secondary:hover, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--secondary:focus, .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button--secondary:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border_hover}; } ************************** Special button -- Dark text on peach background ************************** .b-button--special, .b-button--special:link, .b-button--special:visited { background: {vb:stylevar button_special_background}; border: {vb:stylevar button_special_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_special_text_color.color}; } .b-button--special:focus, .b-button--special:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_special_border_hover}; } ************************** Disabled state. This applies to all button styles above, and must be defined after them to override them. We're using the attribute rather than a modifier to be practical. Of course, this may change... ************************** .b-button[disabled], .b-button[disabled]:hover { border: {vb:stylevar button_disabled_border}; color: {vb:stylevar button_disabled_text_color}; cursor: default; background: {vb:stylevar button_disabled_background}; } Shows a button in the "pressed" state (currently selected, depressed) .b-button.b-button--pressed { background: {vb:stylevar button_pressed_background}; } /* ************************** Full width buttons -- The second, overly specific selector is to override the margins added in b-button-group (css specificity) ************************** */ .b-button--full, .b-button-group .b-button.b-button--full { display: block; float: none; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; margin-bottom: 7px; width: 100%; } .b-button--full:last-child, .b-button-group .b-button.b-button--full:last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } /* ************************** Wide buttons (not to be confused with full width buttons) ************************** */ .b-button--wide { min-width: 230px; } /* ************************** Narrow buttons (as narrow as possible, based on the text in them) ************************** */ .b-button--narrow { min-width: 0; } /* ************************** Icon buttons -- As narrow as possible, same height as buttons with text ************************** */ .b-button--icon, Extra selectors to override other CSS .b-button.b-button--icon { min-width: 0; padding-left: 0.5rem; padding-right: 0.5rem; } .b-button--icon .b-icon { vertical-align: top; } .l-small .b-button--icon .b-icon { vertical-align: middle; } .b-button.b-button--transparent, .b-button.b-button--close-btn { background: transparent; border: none; We use white text color heavily -- primary all states, and secondary on hover. White text on a lighter background is very difficult to read, and on most places we use the transparent button, the background is probably light. So set these button colors to be more certain. Note, the color choices are based on several footer button color choices in the style guide. IMO the footer buttons are most similar to these in that they act as buttons usually with an icon, but are styled more like an inline text element. TODO: Stylevar these? color: {vb:stylevar global_palette_text_01.color}; } .b-button.b-button--close-btn { requires parent to have position:relative. Close button will usually always be flush to the top right corner. position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar right}: 0; } /*-------------------------------------- * UPLOAD BUTTON * -------------------------------------- * * You can create a customized interface by wrapping a tag * with this class around the file input tag: * * 1. Create a file input tag with class .b-form-input__file--hidden * 2. Wrap it in a tag with class .b-button--upload (we recommend using an HTML * .b-button--upload { position: relative; overflow: hidden; } .b-button__upload-label { margin: 0; } ************************** Sitebuilder buttons -- Green with rounded corners The colors should probably be in stylevars, BUT for now I'm just Copying/porting this CSS from the previous declarations. ************************** .b-button--sitebuilder { border-radius: 12px; min-width: 75px; padding: 0.25em 1.2em; } .b-button--sitebuilder, .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--secondary { background-color: #ced0d1; color: #323b44; border: 1px solid #b3b3b3; text-shadow: 0 2px 2px #dfdfdf; box-shadow: 0 1px 2px #cecece; } .b-button--sitebuilder:hover, .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--secondary:hover { background-color: #adb2b5; border: 1px solid #b3b3b3; } .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--primary:not([disabled]) { background-color: #9bd43e; color: #2c3c12; border: 1px solid #94b357; text-shadow: 0 2px 2px #c5df8e; box-shadow: 0 1px 2px #c5df8e; } .b-button--sitebuilder.b-button--primary:not([disabled]):hover { background-color: #b7fc62; border: 1px solid #94b357; } /* ************************** Button text ************************** */ .b-button__text-primary { Placeholder, currently not used for CSS The .js- prefixed counterpart is used in JS. } .b-button__text-secondary { Placeholder, currently not used for CSS. The .js- prefixed counterpart is used in JS. } Set up the sprite path {vb:set imgdir_spriteiconsvb, {vb:stylevar imgdir_spriteiconsvb}} {vb:set spritepath, {vb:concat {vb:stylevar imgdir_spriteiconsvb}, "/sprite_icons_vb_", {vb:stylevar textdirection}, ".png?v=", {vb:var simpleversion} }} {vb:set spritepath, {vb:spritepath sprite_icons_general.svg}} /* ************************** Button icons ************************** */ .b-button__icon { background: transparent url({vb:raw spritepath}) no-repeat scroll 0 0; display: inline-block; height: 8px; width: 8px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 5px; margin-bottom: 1px; vertical-align: middle; } .b-button__icon--plus { background-position: -240px -80px; } .b-button__icon--check { background-position: -256px -96px; } TODO refactor follow_button, unsubscribe_button, post-reply-btn, etc I moved all these here as the first step to refactoring the .button-icon class into .b-button__icon .b-button--follow .b-button__icon, .follow_button .b-button__icon { background-position: -240px -80px; } .b-button--follow.isSubscribed .b-button__icon, .follow_button.subscribed_button .b-button__icon { background-position: -256px -96px; } .b-button--unfollow .b-button__icon, .unsubscribe_button .b-button__icon { display: none; } .b-button--follow.subscribe_pending .b-button__icon, .follow_button.subscribe_pending .b-button__icon { display: none; } .share-btn .b-button__icon { background:transparent url({vb:raw spritepath}) no-repeat scroll -256px -80px; width: 14px; height: 9px; } .post-reply-btn .b-button__icon, .join-btn .b-button__icon { width: 0; height: 0; background: none; display: none; } .pending-post-overlay-container .b-button__icon { background: transparent url({vb:raw spritepath}) no-repeat scroll -512px -16px; height: 10px; width: 6px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-previous .b-button__icon { background-position: -464px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-previous:hover .b-button__icon { background-position: -480px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-previous.hide .b-button__icon { background-position: -496px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-next .b-button__icon { background-position: -512px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-next:hover .b-button__icon { background-position: -528px -16px; } .pending-post-overlay-container .pending-post-next.hide .b-button__icon { background-position: -544px -16px; } Properly position 15px tall icons inside buttons A) without deforming the button (not making it taller), B) while keeping the icon vertically centered, and C) maintain this regardless of text size (which changes with responsive and/or the root_font_size stylevar) .b-button--with-icon-15 { display: inline-flex !important; } .b-button--with-icon-15 .b-button__icon-container { position: relative; display: inline-block; width: 15px; margin-top: auto; margin-bottom: auto; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: auto; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0.4rem; } .b-button--with-icon-15 .b-button__icon-container .b-icon { position: absolute; top: -8px; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .b-button--with-icon-15 .phrase { margin-{vb:stylevar right}: auto; } /* ************************** Responsive buttons -- Larger in tablet size; stacked and larger in phone size. ************************** */ /* Responsive tablet */ .l-small .b-button { font-size: 1.7rem; An explicit line height ensures that all buttons are the same height (avoids VBV-17253) line-height: 2.2rem; padding: 0.4rem 1.36rem; font-weight: normal; /* When buttons are not in a button group, they won't stack in responsive, but there are often enough buttons that they will wrap onto two lines. We add a bottom margin to deal with that. VBV-10848 */ margin-bottom: 4px; } /* Responsive phone */ .l-xsmall .b-button { font-size: 2rem; An explicit line height ensures that all buttons are the same height (avoids VBV-17253) line-height: 2.6rem; padding: 0.8rem 1.6rem; font-weight: normal; /* When buttons are not in a button group, they won't stack in responsive, but there are often enough buttons that they will wrap onto two lines. We add a bottom margin to deal with that. VBV-10848 */ margin-bottom: 4px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This is a re-usable block for grouping buttons together. It separates buttons horizontally within the group at desktop screen sizes, and stacks the buttons vertically at Responsive (small) screen sizes. It also controls if the buttons are grouped to the left or to the right of the screen using the .b-button-group--left and .b-button-group--right modifiers. Obviously, a pre-requisite is that the b-button css will also be loaded/used.

For the left/right aligned button groups, the group itself is still full-width, but the buttons inside the group are floated left or right.

Right aligned button group (default)

Left aligned button group

The .b-button--opposite modifier class allows you to add a button that will be displayed on the opposite side of the group from where the other buttons are.

NOTE: There is no need to use .h-right or .h-left on the buttons, in fact, using it will cause the buttons to not go full width in Responsive. We should also avoid using the .h-right or .h-left classes on the button group. Instead we should have one full-width button group, and if you need to a button or buttons to the opposite side of the group, use the .b-button--opposite class.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-button-group:after { /* clearfix */ clear: both; content: "."; display: block; font-size: 0; height: 0; line-height: 0; visibility: hidden; } .b-button-group .b-button, .b-button-group--right .b-button { display: block; float: {vb:stylevar right}; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; } .b-button-group--left .b-button { float: {vb:stylevar left}; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } /* modifier to float a button to the opposite side of the group from where all the other buttons are */ .b-button-group .b-button--opposite, .b-button-group--right .b-button--opposite { float: {vb:stylevar left}; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .b-button-group--left .b-button--opposite { float: {vb:stylevar right}; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 7px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; } /* Last one doesn't need the margin */ .b-button-group .b-button:last-child { /* Applying the same value to left and right, so stylevars aren't necessary. */ margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; } .b-button-group--contiguous-layout { See .b-module--contiguous margin-{vb:stylevar right}: {vb:stylevar module_content_border.width, withUnits}; } /* Responsive, stack buttons */ .l-xsmall .b-button-group { float: none; clear: both; /* left/right stylevars not needed, since we're setting both the same */ margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-button-group .b-button, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--right .b-button, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--left .b-button { float: none; width: 100%; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; margin-bottom: 10px; } .l-xsmall .b-button-group .b-button:last-child, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--right .b-button:last-child, .l-xsmall .b-button-group--left .b-button:last-child { margin-bottom: 0; } .b-button-group--demo { border: 1px solid #CCC; padding: 15px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The dropdown menu component. Please see the css_b_comp_menu_dropdown.css template for the proper markup and CSS to use, as opposed to inpecting the element, since both the CSS and markup are manipulated by Javascript. Also, there are elements and modifiers that are not shown in these examples, so reading the CSS file is recommended.

The margin is derived from the border widths used for the dividers in .b-top-menu--sitebuilder .divider margin-{vb:stylevar left}: -2px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: -1px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--headerbar.b-comp-menu-dropdown--open { margin-top: 1px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--sitebuilder { Match the height of .b-top-menu--sitebuilder height: 2.2rem; Negative margins allow the menu to fill the entire space between the vertical divider bars. The margin is derived from the border widths used for the dividers in .b-top-menu--sitebuilder .divider margin-{vb:stylevar left}: -2px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: -1px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--sitebuilder.b-comp-menu-dropdown--open .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger { height: calc(2.2rem + 2px); } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--sitebuilder .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger-icon { display: block; margin-top: 2px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--sitebuilder.b-comp-menu-dropdown--open .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger-icon { margin-top: 3px; } Used by the header search dropdown menu - some of the following rules contain ugly but necessary selectors to overide other CSS .b-comp-menu-dropdown--header-search { Height based on b-form-input__input's height + padding height: 100%; width: 2.2rem; display: block; color: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_text_color}; margin: 0 -1px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--header-search .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger { padding: 0; Center the icon vertically display: flex; align-items: center; justify-content: center; } } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--header-search .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger .vb-icon { Left/right stylevars not needed since values are the same margin: 0 auto; } Override "#header .toolbar > ul li" based styles #header .toolbar .b-comp-menu-dropdown--header-search .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item { height: auto; line-height: normal; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: auto; width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; font-weight: normal; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--inactive { /* placeholder used on horizontal menus to indicate they will turn into dropdown menus at small sizes. The placeholder will cause the dropdown css file to be loaded (this file) */ } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--direction-up { This modifier is placed on the containing menu element, and affects both the __trigger and __content elements. The content (dropdown) opens up instead of down, and the bottom of it is aligned with the top of the trigger element. } ********************************************* ***** TRIGGER AND TRIGGER ICON ELEMENTS ***** ********************************************* .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger { Use the border width from the stylevar, set color to transparent border: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border}; border-bottom-width: 0; border-color: transparent; padding: 0.6rem 1.2rem; color: inherit; background: transparent; cursor: pointer; display: block; height: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; position: relative; -webkit-user-select: none; user-select: none; } The --alert class is toggled by JS at the parent level, not the button level. As such we look for the parent class to reduce JS complexity at the cost of longer selectors .b-comp-menu-dropdown--alert .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger { background-color: #cef5ff; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger--outline { border: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border}; If none is specified, the default is left aligned (the left side of the content is aligned with the left side of the trigger) .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--left { {vb:stylevar left}: 0; {vb:stylevar right}: auto; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--right { {vb:stylevar right}: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: auto; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown--open-on-hover:hover .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content, .b-comp-menu-dropdown--open .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content { display: inline-block; } Multiple columns in the menu - keep in sync with MAX_COLUMN_COUNT in css_b_comp_menu_dropdown.js .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--2-column, .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--3-column, .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--4-column { column-gap: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.width, withUnits}; column-rule: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border}; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--2-column { column-count: 2; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--3-column { column-count: 3; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content--4-column { column-count: 4; } ******************************** ***** CONTENT ITEM ELEMENT ***** ******************************** .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item { display: block; This padding matches margin & padding on the contained A element below padding: 0.6rem 1.2rem; cursor: pointer; white-space: nowrap; border-top: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.color}; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item > a { display: block; This margin & padding match the containing LI element above. } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item:hover { background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_item_background_active}; } This is needed to override the styling from .ui-state-hover for module tabs that are converted to dropdowns .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item:hover { background: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_item_background_active}; font-weight: {vb:stylevar toolbar_font.fontWeight}; color: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_text_color}; border-top: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.color}; border-left: 0 none; border-right: 0 none; border-bottom: 0 none; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--current:hover { font-weight: bold; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--no-hover:hover { background: transparent; cursor: default; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item:first-child, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--first, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--column-first, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--first:hover, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--column-first:hover { border-top: 0 none; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--column-trailing { border-bottom: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.color}; } we removed the divider class in most instances so restore the styling for the pmchat dropdown .notifications-container .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--first, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--divider, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--divider:hover { border-top: 2px solid {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_border.color}; } END override style from .ui-state-hover .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--no-hover:hover { background: transparent; cursor: default; } /* We only want the immediate decendant links to avoid situations where the menu item itself displays a link that isn't a "menu link". We use the menu code to display some more complicated "drop down" forms (like the login menu). Tighening this does not appear to cause any bad side effects. If we do have menu links that are not direct children of the content-item then we should create a class to put on them directly such as "b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item-link" and use that to style the specific links instead of a blanket approach we'll end up needing complicated rules to override. */ .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item > a, .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item > a:active, .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item > a:visited { color: {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_text_color}; } b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--unread & b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--unread-alert classes are added by javascript, not templates (pmchat.js) .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--unread { background: {vb:stylevar private_messages_mark_as_unread_background}; font-weight: bold; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--unread-alert { background: #cef5ff; } ************************************** ***** #channel-tabbar dropdown ***** ************************************** Add some padding to searchbox block, similar to the top-menu dropdown message center buttons. We can skip the horizontal padding here, because the __content-item already gets quite a bit of horizontal padding. .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item .search-box { padding: var(--padding-s) 0; } remove padding on xsmall, as the entire __content-item block gets a lot more padding. .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item .search-box { padding: 0; } ************************************** ***** REPLACEMENT SELECT ELEMENT ***** ************************************** .b-comp-menu-dropdown__select { text-transform: initial; } ************************* ***** MISCELLANEOUS ***** ************************* /* Hide the "like" count in the dropdown menu */ .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-post-control__bubble-flyout { display: none; } ********************** ***** RESPONSIVE ***** ********************** .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown { font-size: 1.6rem; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown--block-on-xsmall { display: block; margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger, .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item { padding: 0.6rem 1.6rem; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger--headerbar { padding: 0 0.8rem; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger--icon-trigger { padding: 0; Override the 1em font size for xsmall. font: {vb:stylevar toolbar_font}; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger .b-icon__arrow-down-s { margin-top: -2px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 5px; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item { line-height: 2.2rem; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--indent1 { padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 3.2rem; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item .b-icon:not(.b-icon--show-on-xsmall) { /* This hides the icons on each menu item in the dropdown menu */ display: none; } .l-xsmall .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-post-control__bubble-flyout-container { margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0; } We add these classes in the javascript so we can't just rely on the template restoration to fix the style So overload the new classes to use the old icons. .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger--headerbar .b-icon-fa.b-icon-fa--12.fa-caret-down { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 6px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-icon-fa.b-icon-fa--12.fa-caret-down { background:transparent url("{vb:spritepath sprite_icons_general.svg}") no-repeat scroll 0 0; display: inline-block; overflow: hidden; text-indent: -99999px; width: 7px; height: 6px; background-position: -80px -48px; } .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-icon-fa.b-icon-fa--12.fa-caret-down.b-icon--disabled { background-position: -72px -48px; } ******************************* ***** DEMO / CSS EXAMPLES ***** ******************************* .b-comp-menu-dropdown__wrapper--demo { border: 1px solid #CCC; padding: 5px; margin-bottom: 10px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

A horizontal menu component.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* TODO use element components for the colors, borders, and padding in this template See VBV-15345 */ .b-comp-menu-horizontal { /* placeholder */ } .l-small .b-comp-menu-horizontal .b-post-control--responsive { font-size: 1.3em; line-height: 1.4em; height: 1.5em; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0.3em; padding: 0 0.4em; } .l-small .b-comp-menu-horizontal .b-post-control--responsive .b-post-control__bubble-flyout { top: 0; } .l-small .b-comp-menu-horizontal .b-post-control--responsive .bubble-flyout .bubble-content { font-size: inherit; line-height: inherit; height: inherit; } END CSS RULES

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>


<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * DIVIDER
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>


.b-divider {
	border-style: dotted;
	border-width: 1px 0 0;
	height:0;
	margin: 0;
}


.b-divider--section {
	border-color: {vb:stylevar section_divider_color};
	border-style: solid;
	border-width: 1px 0 0;
	height:0;
	margin: 10px 0;
}

.b-divider--post-controls {
	color:{vb:stylevar post_controls_divider_color};
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

This block is used for form input text fields. Examples:

This input text field just uses the b-form-input__input class.

This text box uses the b-form-input__input and b-form-input__input--full modifier classes.

These use several .b-form-input__* classes, along with .b-icon classes to set up an input and button combo.

An input along with an icon or something to the side that we want centered vertically.

Text vertically centered alongside an input...

File inputs are quite different and we do a lot of work for custom styling. Please see css_b_button.css for usage.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /* Form Inputs */ Keep this in sync with css_editor.css .b-form-input__input, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-form-input__input { background: {vb:stylevar form_field_background}; border: {vb:stylevar form_field_border}; border-radius: 3px; color: {vb:stylevar form_field_text_color}; font: inherit; line-height: 1.4; height: auto; Note: This padding is also used by .b-form-select__select, .selectBox-dropdown, and .selectBox-dropdown .selectBox-label; keep synchronized. padding: 3px 8px; Keeps input vertically aligned with any buttons that are to the right of the input. vertical-align: middle; } .b-form-input__input--border-box, CKEditor-specific selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS .cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-form-input__input--border-box { box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.4; height: auto; } .b-form-input__input--full { box-sizing: border-box; line-height: 1.4; height: auto; width: 100%; } .b-form-input__input--year { width: 3.2em; } .b-form-input__input--shadow { box-shadow: inset {vb:stylevar pos}1px 1px 1px 0px rgba(150, 150, 150, 0.4); } .b-form-input__label { font-weight: bold; } .b-form-input__hint { margin-top: 10px; margin-bottom: 0; font-size: 1.1rem; color: {vb:stylevar text_tertiary_color}; } .l-small .b-form-input__label { display: block; margin-bottom: 4px; } Hide IE10's clear button (X) inside input text control .b-form-input__input--hide-clear-button::-ms-clear { display:none; } A generic container for things that are displayed near inputs and that are closely related to them. This mainly provides a container that is the same height as the input (or select) and will allow centering an "accessory" vertically on the same line as an input. .b-form-input__accessory-container { Height matches that of the input element font: inherit; line-height: 1.4; height: auto; overflow: auto; Match top & bottom padding to the input element padding-top: 3px; padding-bottom: 3px; } /*-------------------------------------- * FILE INPUT * * You can create a customized file input by using the --hidden modifier on * your tag. * * Usage: Please see .b-button--upload * * Note: All the funky rules are for browser compatiblity. We're essentially * trying to get the user to click the "browse..." button they'd normally see * but have it show our customized style underneath so it'll look nice. * **/ .b-form-input__file--hidden { position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar right}: 0; opacity: 0; -o-transform: translate({vb:stylevar pos}250px, -50px) scale(1); -moz-transform: translate({vb:stylevar neg}300px, 0) scale(5); transform: translate({vb:stylevar neg}300px, 0) scale(5); cursor: pointer; margin: 0; border-top-width: 0; border-{vb:stylevar right}-width: 30px; border-bottom-width: 100px; border-{vb:stylevar left}-width: 200px; border-color: transparent; height: 10px; width: 10px; z-index: -1; } Progress bar that is used with .b-form-input__file--hidden .b-form-input__upload-progress { background: url('images/loader-box-blue.gif'); width: 128px; height: 15px; display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 3px; } .b-form-input__upload-progress.h-hide { Since we explicitly set display (above), we need to make it compatible with .h-hide display: none; } .b-form-input__upload-progress--sitebuilder { background: url('images/loader-box-light.gif'); } ***** Classes for an input element with a icon button beside/inside it. ***** If you need to limit the width of the input & button, this container element would be the place to do so. .b-form-input__input-with-button-container { position: relative; width: 200px; Explicitly set default line height since the conversation toolbar messes with line height on input elements. line-height: 1.4; height: auto; } .b-form-input__input-with-button-container--full { width: auto; } .b-form-input__input--with-button { width: 100%; box-sizing: border-box; height calculated from default height + padding + border width, since this element is a border-box. See .b-form-input__input for the default values. line-height: 1.4; height: auto; } .b-form-input__inside-button { position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar right}: 0; width: 25px; bottom: 0; background: {vb:stylevar form_field_inside_button_background}; border: 0; Match border-radius for the input element border-top-{vb:stylevar right}-radius: 3px; border-bottom-{vb:stylevar right}-radius: 3px; padding: 0; cursor: pointer; } Extra selectors to override jQueryUI CSS .b-form-input__input-with-button-container .b-form-input__inside-button { Explicitly set a font-size since the conversation toolbar messes with it and it incorrectly moves the icon up. font-size: 0; } .b-form-input__inside-button-icon { Needed for IE11 - See VBV-18100 vertical-align: middle; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The .b-module* classes will be used for modules. This is a work in progress.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-module { /* placeholder for now */ } /*.b-module here for specificity. Without it this loses to .view-mode .widget-no-border rule. */ .b-module.b-module--flush-vertical { /* Most widgets have a bottom margin of 16px. This makes the channel description module, which is meant to be placed after the page title module, have too much whitespace around it. margin-top: move the module closer to the page title module to make it aesthetically similar vb4 channel descriptions. margin-bottom: override the default 16px bottom margin on .view-mode .widget-no-border, make the subchannel or channel content module closer to the channel description to make it aesthetically similar to vB5 CMS channel descriptions (which are part of the channel display module itself, next to the "Subscribe" button) */ margin-top: -16px; margin-bottom: 0px; } /* Rules for the show_at_breakpoints config item These rules currently use 'body' in the selector because the l-small class gets added to the narrow columns in a layout even when not in responsive. See VBV-11460. Note: The "small" rules are first because the JS doesn't remove the "l-small" class when it adds "l-xsmall". */ Simple breakpoint rules body.l-desktop .b-module--hide-desktop { display: none; } body.l-small .b-module--hide-small { display: none; } body.l-xsmall .b-module--hide-xsmall { display: none; } Complex breakpoint rules (we can have .l-small and .l-xsmall simultaneously) /* remove any effect of hide-small if we are really in xsmall */ body.l-small.l-xsmall .b-module--hide-small { display: block; } /* re-hide in xsmall */ body.l-small.l-xsmall .b-module--hide-xsmall { display: none; } Fix borders, corner radius and spacing for contiguous modules .view-mode .b-layout--contiguous .b-module--contiguous { border: {vb:stylevar module_content_border}; margin: -{vb:stylevar module_content_border.width, withUnits} 0 0 0; } .view-mode .b-layout--contiguous .has-adjacent-left-col .b-module--contiguous { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: -{vb:stylevar module_content_border.width, withUnits}; } .view-mode.l-small .b-layout--contiguous .has-adjacent-left-col .b-module--contiguous { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .view-mode .b-layout--contiguous .l-row.has-columns { margin-bottom: 15px; } END CSS RULES

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>



<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>

<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * NAMECARD
 *------------------------------------*/
</vb:comment>
:root {
	--namecard-margin: 15px;
	--namecard-between-rows-margin: 8px;
	--namecard-inner-width: 300px;
	--namecard-inner-height: 120px;
}
.b-namecard:not(.h-hide-imp) {
	display: flex !important; 
	flex-direction: column;
	width: var(--namecard-inner-width);
	min-height: var(--namecard-inner-height);
	margin: var(--namecard-margin);
	<vb:comment>apparently mobile can be pretty narrow, like this "galaxy fold" which is only 280px. At that point, we probably need a different responsive layout rather than maintaining the layout. For now, putting in a max width logic just so all the info *fits* on the view port.</vb:comment>
	max-width: calc(100vw - var(--namecard-margin) * 2);
	<vb:comment>for extra long displaynames/usernames..</vb:comment>
	word-break: break-all;
	font-size: 1.5rem;
	line-height: 2rem;
}
<vb:comment>
	visual hierarchy.
	Displayname heaviest,
	userame & usertitle middling,
	misc info lesser
</vb:comment>
.b-namecard__primary {
	font-size: 1.8rem;
	line-height: 2rem;
}
.b-namecard__secondary {
	<vb:comment>this is the same as the default in b-namecard rule above, so this one may not be needed unless we have to override something nested.</vb:comment>
	font-size: 1.5rem;
	line-height: 2rem;
}
.b-namecard__tertiary {
	font-size: 1.1rem;
	line-height: 1.5rem;
}
.b-namecard__top,
.b-namecard__middle,
.b-namecard__bottom {
	display: flex; 
	flex-direction: row;
}
.b-namecard__middle,
.b-namecard__bottom {
	justify-content: space-between;
}
.b-namecard__middle:not(.h-hide),
.b-namecard__bottom:not(.h-hide) {
	margin-top: var(--namecard-between-rows-margin);
}
.b-namecard__middle {
	flex-wrap: wrap;
}
.b-namecard--buttons {
	display: flex;
	flex-direction: row;
	justify-content: space-between;
}
.b-namecard__close,
.b-namecard__close button{
	width: 100%;
}
.b-namecard .avatar {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: var(--namecard-margin);
	margin-bottom: var(--namecard-margin);
}
.b-namecard--avatar-online-status {
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}: calc(-2 * var(--namecard-margin));
}
.b-namecard--divider {
	border: {vb:stylevar profile_content_divider_border};
	border-width: {vb:stylevar profile_content_divider_border.width, withUnits} 0 0;
	height: 0;
	margin: 0;
}
<vb:comment>override some default qtip styling</vb:comment>
.qtip--b-namecard.qtip {
	<vb:comment>I don't know why qtip forces direction to LTR. This is an attemp to restore RTL support via flexbox ordering below.</vb:comment>
	direction: inherit;
}
.qtip--b-namecard .qtip-content {
	padding: 0;
}
.qtip--b-namecard.qtip {
	max-width: calc(var(--namecard-inner-width) + 2*var(--namecard-margin));
	<vb:comment>do we need -5px for the horizontal offset when RTL?</vb:comment>
    box-shadow: 5px 5px 5px grey;
}

<vb:comment>responsive</vb:comment>
.l-xsmall .b-namecard--onresponsive-columnize {
	flex-direction: column;
}
.l-xsmall .b-namecard--onresponsive-columnize .b-namecard--buttons {
	flex-direction: column;
	order: 0;
}
.l-xsmall .b-namecard--onresponsive-columnize .b-button {
	width: 100%;
}
<vb:comment>copy of the l-xsmall b-button rules to make these interactables all look the same on small screens...</vb:comment>
.l-xsmall .b-namecard__button-on-xsmall {
	font-size: 2rem;
	line-height: 2.6rem;
	padding: 0.8rem 1.6rem;
	font-weight: normal;
	margin-bottom: 4px;
	<vb:comment>b-button rules</vb:comment>
	border-radius: 2px;
	border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border};
	<vb:comment>center</vb:comment>
	display: flex;
	justify-content: center;
	<vb:comment>full width</vb:comment>
	width: calc(100% - 2 * (--namecard-margin));
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>


<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * POST
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-post {
	border: {vb:stylevar post_border};
	margin-top: 10px;
	width: 100%;
	border-radius: 3px;
	padding-bottom: 0;
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_background};
	position: relative;
	<vb:comment>Needs border-box because it's 100% wide and has borders, otherwise it will be a couple pixels wider than the other elements on the layout.</vb:comment>
	box-sizing: border-box;
}

<vb:comment>pinned answer styling</vb:comment>
.b-post.pinned-answer {
	border-style: solid;
	<vb:comment>/* Keep this in sync with .b-post .answer-label background-color below. */</vb:comment>
	border-color: {vb:stylevar global_palette_accent_01.color};
	border-width: 5px;
	<vb:comment>/*part 1 to restore the rounded left borders of the userinfo block/left column */</vb:comment>
	background-color: {vb:stylevar global_palette_accent_01.color};
}
.b-post.pinned-answer > div.l-row {
	<vb:comment>/*part 2 to restore the rounded left borders of the userinfo block/left column */</vb:comment>
	border-radius: 3px;
	background-color: {vb:stylevar postbit_background.color};
}
.b-post .answer-label {
	margin-top: 10px;
	<vb:comment>/* Based on the stylevars that the footer element inherits, to use the iconic vBulletin blue/navy bg color with white text. */</vb:comment>
	background-color: {vb:stylevar global_palette_accent_01.color};
	color: {vb:stylevar global_palette_text_03.color};
	<vb:comment>/* Using same font style as conversation-status-emssage.notice */</vb:comment>
	font-weight:bold;
	font-size: 1.4rem;
	padding: 6px 10px;
	<vb:comment>/* work around background bleedthrough issue.*/</vb:comment>
	margin: -1px;
}

.b-post .answer-label a, 
.b-post .answer-label a:active,
.b-post .answer-label a:visited,
.b-post .answer-label .b-link {
	color: {vb:stylevar global_palette_text_05.color}
}

.b-post--pmchat {
	border: none;
	background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_content_background};
}

.b-post__body {
	position: relative;
	background:{vb:stylevar thread_reply_background};
	border-radius:3px;
}

.b-post__body--pmchat {
	border-radius: 7px;
	<vb:comment>Stylevars not needed, since we're setting both left and right to the same value.</vb:comment>
	margin-left: 10px;
	margin-right: 10px;
}

.b-post__body--pmchat-mine {
	background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_mine_background}; 
	border-color: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_mine_background.color}; 
}

.b-post__body--pmchat-theirs {
	background: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_theirs_background}; 
	border-color: {vb:stylevar vbmessenger_chatwindow_message_theirs_background.color}; 
}

.b-post__arrow {
	position: absolute;
	top:35px;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px solid {vb:stylevar thread_reply_background.backgroundColor};
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	{vb:stylevar left}: -10px;
	{vb:stylevar right}: auto;
}

.b-post__arrow--pmchat {
	top: 25px;
}

.b-post__arrow--left {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px solid;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-{vb:stylevar left}: 0px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: -10px;
	{vb:stylevar right}: auto;
}

.b-post__arrow--right {
	border-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px solid;
	border-{vb:stylevar left}-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 0px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: auto;
	{vb:stylevar right}: -10px;
}

.b-post__title {
	font-size: 1.6rem;
	font-weight: bold;
}

.b-post__stream-post-title {
	font-weight: bold;
}

<vb:comment>/* when displaying post the footer should not have any margin (VBV-12195) */</vb:comment>
.blog-list .b-post__footer {
	<vb:comment>/* not using left/right stylevars, since we're setting the same margin on both */</vb:comment>
	margin-left: 0;
	margin-right: 0;
}

<vb:comment>
		The caption isn't included in the table border so we need to play some games to 
		make it look like it is.
</vb:comment>
.b-post__infoblock {
	display: table;
	border: {vb:stylevar post_border};
	border-top: 0;
	border-radius: 0px 0px 5px 5px;
}

.b-post__infoblock--wide {
	width:100%;
}

<vb:comment>
	Compensates when the header element is absent.  Once the has psuedo element is 
	broadly supported we should be able to this without an explicit modifier
</vb:comment>
.b-post__infoblock.b-post__infoblock--noheader {
	border-radius: 5px;
	border-top: {vb:stylevar post_border};
}

<vb:comment>
		We have to use the caption because there is no colspan in css and we want this
		to span the entire table width.  It's still reasonable semantic because it's intend
		to hold a table title explaining the table contents (even if it's more of a title)
</vb:comment>
.b-post__infoblock--header {
	display: table-caption;
	padding: 8px 12px;
	border-radius: 5px 5px 0px 0px;
}
	
.b-post__infoblock--item {
	display: table-row;
}
	
.b-post__infoblock-cell {
	display: table-cell;
	padding: 8px 12px;
}
		
.b-post__infoblock-cell--label {
	<vb:comment>This will still expand to allow the text length</vb:comment>
	width: 20%;
}

<vb:comment>
		For now let's link the styling of the header/label cells but let's not attempt to link them in the 
		markup so we can change them directly in the css without a lot of weirdness.
</vb:comment>
.b-post__infoblock--header,	
.b-post__infoblock-cell--label {
	border-bottom: {vb:stylevar post_border};
	border-bottom-color: {vb:stylevar thread_starter_background.backgroundColor};

	background: {vb:stylevar event_label_background};
	color: {vb:stylevar event_label_text_color};
	font-weight: bold;
}

.b-post__infoblock-cell--content {
	border-bottom: {vb:stylevar post_border};
}

.b-post__infoblock--item:last-child .b-post__infoblock-cell {
	border-bottom: 0 none;
}

.b-post__customfield-content--textarea {
	white-space: pre-line;
}

<vb:comment>
/* TODO:
 *
 * The !important declaration is needed here because during the transition to
 * the new CSS framework we're having to overcoming a hierarchy of rules. The
 * !important should be able to be removed when we're done.
 **/
</vb:comment>
.b-post__count,
.b-post__timestamp {
	color:{vb:stylevar time_stamp_color} !important;
}

.b-post__count {
	font-size: 1.2rem;
}

.b-post__timestamp {
	font-size: 1.1rem;
}

.b-post .l-col__fixed {
	padding-top:15px;
	padding-{vb:stylevar right}:25px;
	padding-bottom:15px;
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}:15px;
}


.b-post .b-divider--section {
	display: none;
}

.b-post__date {
	font-size: 1.1rem;
	color:{vb:stylevar time_stamp_color};
	line-height: 2rem;
	text-align: {vb:stylevar left};
}


.b-post__label {
	border: 1px solid #5F6A6F;
	height: 1.2rem;
	margin-top: 8px;
	float: {vb:stylevar left};
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
	padding: 1px 4px;
	color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color};
	font: {vb:stylevar post_label_font};
	display: inline-block;
}

.b-post .b-post-attachments {
	margin-top: 10px;
}


.b-post--unapproved .b-post__arrow {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: {vb:stylevar postbit_unapproved_background.color};
}

.b-post--unapproved .b-post__body {
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_unapproved_background};
}

.b-post--first:not(.b-post--unapproved) .b-post__arrow {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: {vb:stylevar thread_starter_background.backgroundColor};
}

.b-post--first:not(.b-post--unapproved) .b-post__body {
	background: {vb:stylevar thread_starter_background};
}

.b-post--deleted {
	background: {vb:stylevar postbit_deleted_background};
}

.b-post--deleted .b-comments,
.b-post--deleted .b-post__footer,
.b-post--deleted .b-post__hide-when-deleted {
	display: none;
}

.b-post--deleted .b-divider--section {
	display: block;
}

<vb:comment>This comes after b-post--deleted to override it.</vb:comment>
.b-post--show-deleted-content .b-post__hide-when-deleted {
	display: block;
}


<vb:comment>
	Inline moderation highlight should always override the other colors.
	@TODO: Rename .inlinemod_highlight when we redo inlinemod CSS.
</vb:comment>
.inlinemod_highlight .b-post__arrow {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: {vb:stylevar inlinemod_post_selected_background.backgroundColor};
}

.inlinemod_highlight .b-post__body {
	background: {vb:stylevar inlinemod_post_selected_background};
}

.b-post__unpublish-info {
	font-size: 1.2rem;
	line-height: 1.6rem;
}

.b-post__content {
	font: {vb:stylevar post_content_font};
}

.b-post__content--edit,
.b-post__footer--edit {
	display: none;
}
.b-post__content .post-signature {
	border-top: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar post_controls_divider_color};
	margin-top: 0px;
	margin-bottom:15px;
	padding-top: 15px;
	clear:both;
}


.b-post__edit {
	font-style: italic;
	<vb:comment>Changed from clear:left to clear:both to account for right-floated content, such as when the post text ends with a right aligned image inserted inline.</vb:comment>
	clear: both;
}

.b-post__history {
	cursor: pointer;
}

.b-post__article-meta-wrapper .avatar-sm,
.b-post__article-meta-wrapper .avatar-sm img {
	height: 16px;
	width: 16px;
}

.b-post__article-meta {
	color: {vb:stylevar time_stamp_color};
	font-size: 1.2rem;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item {
	line-height: 1.4rem;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item .avatar {
	margin: 0;
	width: 14px;
	height: 14px;
	display: inline;
	vertical-align: middle;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item a {
	vertical-align: middle;
}

.b-post__article-meta-item--inline {
	display: inline;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 8px;
}

.l-small .b-post__article-meta-item--inline {
	display: block;
	line-height: 1.76rem;
}
.l-small .b-post__article-meta-item--sharing-menu-container {
	position: absolute;
	top: 3px;
	{vb:stylevar right}: 0;
}


.b-post__not-published-notice {
	color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_login_error_text_color}; /* this stylevar should be renamed to warning_color or similar*/
}

<vb:comment>
/* Ordinarily I'd want to handle this with a helper on the
 * content-entry div, but not knowing what other dependencies
 * there might be, we're situationally adding the margin when it's
 * inside an editable post */
</vb:comment>
.b-post--edit .b-content-entry {
	margin-bottom: {vb:stylevar spacing_margin_xl};
}

.b-post--edit .b-toolbar {
	max-height: 44px;
	/* overflow: hidden; */
}


<vb:comment>
/*
 * The b-post--preview modifier is added to the container of a post being
 * displayed in a dialog. We use a bit of selector inheritance to constrain
 * the rules, but use generalized modifier classes to adjust the behavior of
 * multiple elements, so that the intent (e.g. h-hide--on-preview) is
 * understood by looking at the HTML template, rather than trying to capture
 * all of the normal CSS class names in these rules.
 *
 * Because it's a modifier and we need to be assured of overriding rules,
 * this is a case when use of !important is acceptable.
 **/
</vb:comment>

.b-post--preview .h-hide--on-preview {
	display: none;
}

.b-post--preview .h-restore--on-preview {
	margin: 0 !important;
	padding: 0 !important;
	border: none !important;
	border-radius: 0;
	background: inherit !important;
}

.b-post__preview-image {
	border: 1px solid {vb:stylevar post_border.borderColor};
}

<vb:comment>style copied from .b-post-attachments</vb:comment>
.b-post__gallery-notice {
	padding: 5px;
	padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 9px;
	color: {vb:stylevar module_tab_text_color};
	border-radius: 3px;
	border: {vb:stylevar post_border};
	background: {vb:stylevar contententry_panel_background};
}

<vb:comment> In the responsive view, point the arrow upwards. </vb:comment>
.l-small .b-post__arrow {
	top: -10px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: 39px;
	border-bottom: 10px solid {vb:stylevar thread_reply_background.backgroundColor};
	border-top: none;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 6px solid transparent;
	border-{vb:stylevar left}: 6px solid transparent;
}

.l-small .b-post--unapproved .b-post__arrow {
	border-bottom-color: {vb:stylevar postbit_unapproved_background.color};
}

.l-small .b-post--first:not(.b-post--unapproved) .b-post__arrow {
	border-bottom-color: {vb:stylevar thread_starter_background.backgroundColor};
}

.l-small .inlinemod_highlight .b-post__arrow {
	border-bottom-color: {vb:stylevar inlinemod_post_selected_background.backgroundColor};
}

.l-small .b-post__arrow--pmchat {
	top: 15px;
}

<vb:comment>Maintain left & right arrow directions in responsive</vb:comment>
.l-small .b-post__arrow--left {
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px solid;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-{vb:stylevar left}: 0px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: -10px;
	{vb:stylevar right}: auto;
}

.l-small .b-post__arrow--right {
	border-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px solid;
	border-{vb:stylevar left}-color: inherit;
	border-top: 6px solid transparent;
	border-bottom: 6px solid transparent;
	border-{vb:stylevar right}: 0px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: auto;
	{vb:stylevar right}: -10px;
}


<vb:comment>
/* TODO: Remove these temporary hacks once all the streamview templates have
 * been converted over to the new CSS.
 **/
</vb:comment>

.blog-conversation-content-widget .b-post-attachments {
	display: block;
}


<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Post Controls are the little action links with icons at the bottom of the post. They include:

  • Infractions
  • Edit
  • Flag
  • Quote
  • Comment
  • Like / Unlike
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES /*-------------------------------------- * POST CONTROLS *------------------------------------*/ .b-post-control { display: inline-block; float: {vb:stylevar left}; color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color}; font: {vb:stylevar post_controls_font}; position: relative; padding: 1px 4px; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 3px; cursor: pointer; } .b-post-control, .b-post-control__icon, .b-post-control__label { vertical-align: middle; } .b-post-control__label { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 2px; } set answer button features .b-post-control .show-on-isanswer, .isanswer .b-post-control .hide-on-isanswer { display: none; } .isanswer .b-post-control .show-on-isanswer { display: inline-block; } ************* BUBBLE-FLYOUT ************* .b-post-control__bubble-flyout-container { margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 26px; } .b-post-control__bubble-flyout { position: absolute; {vb:stylevar right}: -26px; {vb:stylevar left}: auto; top: -1px; background: {vb:stylevar content_background}; /* Override the responsive button color. */ color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color}; } /* There are some problems with the bubble flyout block that's part of the "like" footer button. They aren't really noticeable unless you have another button after it, which is now a real possibility. We should probably make the bubble css more robust, but for now adding in some workarounds that are more targetted to the newly added footer button to lower regression risk. Workaround for now: for the button after the like button, add 4px extra padding to the left to make up for the fact that the .bubble-flyout element extends far past the container's padding/margins, and does not have its own 4px right padding. */ .b-post-control__bubble-flyout-container + .b-post-control { padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 8px; } TODO refactor .bubble-flyout and move here .b-post-control--disabled { cursor:auto; } .l-small .b-post-control--responsive { color: #fff; background-color: #2379B5; border-radius: 2px; height: 1.8rem; line-height: 1.8rem; padding: 0 0.8em; } .l-small .b-post-control__label { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .l-small .b-post-control--responsive .b-post-control__icon { display: none; } We still want the color to apply in the responsive view, so this comes after. .b-post-control__quote--selected .b-post-control__label { color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_quote_active_text_color}; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The b-post-sm block displays a post in the Search Module.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES .b-post-sm { margin-top: 15px; padding-top: 15px; border-top: {vb:stylevar module_search_list_item_border}; } .b-post-sm--compact { margin-top: 0; padding-top: 0; border-top: none; } .b-post-sm:first-child { padding-top: 0; border-top: none; } //These rules have never done anything useful. Should remove them and the classes from the markup. .b-post-sm__content { /* */ } .b-post-sm__title { font-weight: bold; } .b-post-sm__author { /* */ } .b-post-sm__desc { /* */ } .b-post-sm__post-content { /* */ } .b-post-sm__footer { /* */ } .b-post-sm__content--has-avatar { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 44px; } .b-post-sm__date { font-size: 1.1rem; color: {vb:stylevar time_stamp_color}; text-align: {vb:stylevar right}; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Menu component for social sharing links.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES ***** Sharing menu as a vertical list under userinfo (forums & groups) ***** .b-sharing-menu { list-style: none; Margin left keeps it centered, since 10px is taken from the right side for the b-post__arrow element margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px; text-align: center; } .b-sharing-menu__item { margin: 0 auto 4px auto; } .b-sharing-menu__item-link { display: block; box-sizing: border-box; min-width: 60px; height: 2rem; margin: auto; border-radius: 3px; font-size: 1.1rem; line-height: 2.1rem; background: {vb:stylevar content_background}; color: {vb:stylevar body_link_color}; } Extra selectors needed to override other CSS rules on the A element a.b-sharing-menu__item-link, a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:visited, a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:active, a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:hover, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:hover, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:hover { text-decoration: none; } This rule with extra selectors is only needed because there are other overreaching CSS rules that affect A elements in the menu .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item .b-sharing-menu__item-link { padding: 0; margin: auto; } .b-sharing-menu__item-link-img { width: 16px; height: 16px; vertical-align: middle; } The extra selectors here (specifically .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a) are needed because there are otehr overreaching CSS rules concerning the A element .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--facebook, .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--facebook:visited { Hard-coded facebook styles font-weight: bold; font-family: Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; background: #4267B2; color: #FFF; } .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--facebook:hover, .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--facebook:active { Hard-coded facebook styles background: #365899; color: #FFF; } .b-sharing-menu__item-link--facebook .b-sharing-menu__item-link-img { width: 16px; height: 16px; margin-top: -2px; } .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--twitter, .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--twitter:visited { Hard-coded twitter styles font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Arial, sans-serif; background: #1B95E0; color: #FFF; } .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--twitter:hover, .b-sharing-menu .b-sharing-menu__item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link--twitter:active { Hard-coded twitter styles background: #0C7ABF; color: #FFF; } .b-sharing-menu__item-link--twitter .b-sharing-menu__item-link-img { width: 14px; height: 14px; margin-top: -2px; } /* We need extra selectors for adding the color to override the base styles until those are removed or changed. */ .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:active, .b-comp-menu-dropdown .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:visited, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:active, .widget-tabs.ui-tabs .ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:visited, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:active, .sb-dialog.ui-dialog-content.ui-widget-content .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item a.b-sharing-menu__item-link:visited { Hard-coded facebook and twitter color color: #FFF; } ***** Sharing menu as a horizontal list beside userinfo (articles & blogs) ***** .b-sharing-menu--horizontal { display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle; margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } .b-sharing-menu--horizontal .b-sharing-menu__item { display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle; } ***** Sharing menu as dropdown menu (Responsive) ***** .b-sharing-menu__item.b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item, .b-sharing-menu--horizontal .b-sharing-menu__item { margin: 0; } .b-sharing-menu.b-sharing-menu--dropdown { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0; } ***** Misc rules ***** .b-sharing-menu__item-twitter-wrapper { Matches the height of the twitter button; needed to keep the twitter iframe from going taller than the button height: 20px; } Rules to avoid FOUC for social sharing -- uses classes from the 3rd party markup .fb-share-button:not(.fb_iframe_widget), .twitter-share-button:not(.twitter-share-button-rendered) { display: none; } ***** Responsive ***** Forum and group topics .l-small .b-sharing-menu--right-on-small { position: absolute; {vb:stylevar right}: 0; bottom: 8px; } Blog posts and articles .l-small .b-sharing-menu--inline-on-small { height: 14px; } .l-small .b-sharing-menu--inline-on-small .b-comp-menu-dropdown__trigger--icon-trigger { margin-top: -8px; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

The .b-toggle-slider block displays a pair of Yes/No radio buttons with some Yes/No slider eye candy. To use it, include the template toggle_slider. Here are some examples.

{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button', checked='yes'}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button', checked='yes'}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button2', checked='yes', yesLabel={vb:phrase on}, noLabel={vb:phrase off}}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button2', checked='yes', yesLabel={vb:phrase on}, noLabel={vb:phrase off}}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button3', checked='no'}
{vb:template toggle_slider, name='my_radio_button3', checked='no'}
END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES There are various colors hard-coded in this file. They were copied from the .switch-control class definitions. They should be assigned stylevars and changed together. In the future, .switch-control should be replaced by .b-toggle-slider. .b-toggle-slider__wrapper { min-width: 90px; } .b-toggle-slider { position: relative; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; border: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border}; font-size: 1.2rem; min-width: 34px; height: 1.8rem; cursor: pointer; border-radius: 2px; Don't use -webkit-touch-callout. See note on .noselect -webkit-user-select: none; -khtml-user-select: none; -moz-user-select: none; -ms-user-select: none; user-select: none; } .b-toggle-slider__label { line-height: 1.8rem; min-width: 16px; text-align: center; padding: 0 5px; position: relative; } .b-toggle-slider__label--yes { float: {vb:stylevar right}; background: {vb:stylevar toggle_slider_yes_background}; color: {vb:stylevar toggle_slider_yes_text_color}; } .b-toggle-slider__label--no { float: {vb:stylevar left}; background: {vb:stylevar toggle_slider_no_background}; color: {vb:stylevar toggle_slider_no_text_color}; } .b-toggle-slider__handle { background: {vb:stylevar toggle_slider_handle_background}; display: inline-block; height: 100%; width: 100%; position: absolute; top: 0; border-radius: 2px; } .b-toggle-slider__handle--yes { {vb:stylevar right}: 0; border-{vb:stylevar left}: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border}; } .b-toggle-slider__handle--no { {vb:stylevar left}: 0; border-{vb:stylevar right}: {vb:stylevar button_secondary_border}; } .b-toggle-slider--yes .b-toggle-slider__handle--yes, .b-toggle-slider--no .b-toggle-slider__handle--no { display: none; } .b-toggle-slider--yes .b-toggle-slider__handle--no, .b-toggle-slider--no .b-toggle-slider__handle--yes { display: inline-block; } .b-toggle-slider__radio { position: absolute; top: 0; {vb:stylevar left}: 0; visibility: hidden; } END CSS RULES

BEGIN DOCUMENTATION

Menu element used for the sitebuilder menu and the user menu at the top of the page.

END DOCUMENTATION BEGIN CSS RULES ***** Menu Background (full page width) ***** :root { --top-menu-height: 2.8rem; --topmenu-sb-height: 2.3rem; } .b-top-menu__background { box-sizing: border-box; background: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_background}; TODO: We need the explicit height for now, until we change the background image to use a CSS gradient height:var(--top-menu-height); padding: 0 20px; border-bottom: 1px solid {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_divider_left_color}; } .b-top-menu__background--sitebuilder { height: var(--topmenu-sb-height); box-sizing: content-box; } .l-xsmall .b-top-menu__background, .b-top-menu__background--compact { padding: 0 2px; } ***** Menu Container (content width) ***** .b-top-menu__container { box-sizing: border-box; width: {vb:stylevar wrapper_width}; max-width: {vb:stylevar wrapper_max_width}; margin: auto; } .b-top-menu__container:after { Clearfix clear:both; content:"."; display:block; font-size:0; height:0; line-height:0; visibility:hidden; } ***** Menu (list element) ***** .b-top-menu { box-sizing: border-box; } .b-top-menu:after { Clearfix clear:both; content:"."; display:block; font-size:0; height:0; line-height:0; visibility:hidden; } .b-top-menu--sitebuilder { float: {vb:stylevar left}; } .b-top-menu--sitebuilder .b-top-menu__item { float: {vb:stylevar left}; } .b-top-menu--user { float: {vb:stylevar right}; } .b-top-menu--user .b-top-menu__item { float: {vb:stylevar left}; } ***** Menu Items (list item elements) ***** .b-top-menu__item { box-sizing: border-box; Vertically align the toggle control & Admin CP button display: flex; align-items: center; margin: 0; Note: The negative margins used for .b-comp-menu-dropdown--headerbar are derived from this border width. Keep syncronized. Note: Harded-coded left/right are okay when the values are the same. border-left: 1px solid transparent; border-right: 1px solid transparent; Note: The left border gets the divider "right" color so that it's on the right side of the divider between the links. border-{vb:stylevar left}-color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_divider_right_color}; border-{vb:stylevar right}-color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_divider_left_color}; } .b-top-menu__item:after { Clearfix clear:both; content:"."; display:block; font-size:0; height:0; line-height:0; visibility:hidden; } .b-top-menu__item--no-left-divider { height:var(--top-menu-height); border-{vb:stylevar left}: 0px solid transparent; } .b-top-menu__item--no-right-divider { height:var(--top-menu-height); border-{vb:stylevar right}: 0px solid transparent; } .b-top-menu__background--sitebuilder .b-top-menu__item--no-left-divider, .b-top-menu__background--sitebuilder .b-top-menu__item--no-right-divider { height: var(--topmenu-sb-height); } .b-top-menu__item--sitebuilder-toggle { Matches padding on the Main Navigation bar (top user bar) dropdown menus .b_menu__dropdownbutton padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px; } ***** Menu Item Links ***** .b-top-menu__item-link { box-sizing: border-box; Vertically align the notifications & messages counts, and user avatar display: flex; align-items: center; TODO: We need the explicit height for now, until we change the background image to use a CSS gradient height: 2.7rem; Matches padding on the Main Navigation bar (top user bar) dropdown menus .b_menu__dropdownbutton padding: 0 10px; font: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_font}; line-height: 2.7rem; } .b-top-menu__item-link--compact { padding: 0 5px; } .b-top-menu__background--sitebuilder .b-top-menu__item-link { height: var(--topmenu-sb-height); line-height: var(--topmenu-sb-height); } Extra selectors are needed for the links (specifically ".b-top-menu__item" and "a") to override other CSS .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link { We were previously using the disabled color, so keeping that for now to avoid unwanted side effects. /*color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_text_color};*/ color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_text_disabled_color}; } .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link:hover, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link:active { color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_text_color_hover}; } .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link.b-top-menu__item-link--disabled, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link.b-top-menu__item-link--disabled:hover, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link.b-top-menu__item-link--disabled:active { Keeping the previous hard-coded color for now to avoid unwanted changes. /*color: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admin_bar_text_disabled_color};*/ color: #818080; cursor: default; } .b-top-menu__item-link--selected, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link.b-top-menu__item-link--selected, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link.b-top-menu__item-link--selected:hover, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link.b-top-menu__item-link--selected:active { color:{vb:stylevar inline_edit_folder_active_color}; background:#2E3740; height: var(--topmenu-sb-height); } .b-top-menu__background--sitebuilder .b-top-menu__item-link--admincp { height: 1.8rem; line-height: 1.8rem; border-radius: 2px; background: {vb:stylevar main_nav_admincp_button_background}; font-size: 1.1rem; padding: 0 5px; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 2px; } Extra selectors are needed for the links (specifically ".b-top-menu__item" and "a") to override other CSS .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link--admincp, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link--admincp:hover, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link--admincp:active { color: #FFF; Vertically align the gear icon in the Admin CP button display: flex; align-items: center; } .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link--admincp.b-top-menu__item-link--disabled, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link--admincp.b-top-menu__item-link--disabled:hover, .b-top-menu__item a.b-top-menu__item-link--admincp.b-top-menu__item-link--disabled:active { color: #FFF; opacity:0.5; } .b-top-menu__item-link--admincp .b-icon { display: inline-block; vertical-align: text-bottom; margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 4px; } END CSS RULES

<vb:if condition="!empty($example)">
<vb:comment>BEGIN DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>


<vb:comment>END DOCUMENTATION</vb:comment>

<vb:else />

<vb:comment>BEGIN CSS RULES</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>

/*--------------------------------------
 * USER INFO
 *------------------------------------*/

</vb:comment>

.b-userinfo {
	text-align: center;
	color: {vb:stylevar post_user_info_color};
	padding: 15px 15px 10px;
}

.b-userinfo--pmchat {
	display: inline-block;
}

.b-userinfo__rank {
	/* TODO: is this really the stylevar we want to use? */
	color: {vb:stylevar post_controls_text_color};
}

.b-userinfo__icons {
	position: absolute;
	bottom: 10px;
	{vb:stylevar left}: 10px;
}

.b-userinfo__icon {
	text-align: center;
	width: 16px;
	height: 16px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 4px;
}

.b-userinfo__icon:last-child {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 0;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo {
	text-align: {vb:stylevar left};
	padding: 10px;
	<vb:comment>Allows positioning the sharing menu in Responsive</vb:comment>
	position: relative;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo .b-avatar,
.l-small .b-userinfo__details,
.l-small .b-userinfo__additional-info {
	display: inline-block;
	vertical-align: top;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo .b-avatar {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 5px;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo__details {
	<vb:comment>The 75px is the width of the avatar + fudge factor, to ensure that
	the .b-userinfo__details block doesn't move under the avatar if it has long data 
	in it. See VBV-20318.</vb:comment>
	max-width: calc(100% - 75px);
}

.l-small .b-userinfo__additional-info-block {
	margin-top: 5px;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo__additional-info {
	margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
}

.l-small .b-userinfo__icons {
	top: 10px;
	bottom: auto;
	{vb:stylevar left}: auto;
	{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
}

<vb:comment>END CSS RULES</vb:comment>
</vb:if>

<vb:comment>/*
	Viewport rules to compliment the meta viewport tag (keep them in sync)
	These need to come before any media queries
*/</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>/* IE11 and Edge */</vb:comment>
@-ms-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
<vb:comment>/* Opera Mini */</vb:comment>
@-o-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
<vb:comment>/* Not supported by default, but can be enabled in Chrome */</vb:comment>
@-webkit-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
<vb:comment>/* Not yet supported by Firefox, but we can hope */</vb:comment>
@-moz-viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}
@viewport {
	width: device-width;
	zoom: 1;
}

html {
	<vb:comment>
		The above @-ms-viewport rule triggers IE11's autohiding scrollbars,
		which appear when you mouse over the page or scroll it. The issue is that
		the scrollbars obscure content and make any links/buttons near the right edge
		difficult or impossible to click. This rule ensures we always display
		"traditional" scrollbars that take up space from the viewport, but that don't
		obscure any content. See VBV-16177. This is a workaround for the fact that
		the viewport rule causes the autohiding scrollbars to be used.
	</vb:comment>
	-ms-overflow-style: scrollbar;

	font-size: {vb:stylevar root_font_size};
}

<vb:comment> iPhone X only - See viewport-fit=cover and VBV-17953 </vb:comment>
