}

<vb:comment>
	*** Accessibility: Show focus outline on all elements that can be focused ***
</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>Basic elements</vb:comment>
a:focus,
input:focus,
textarea:focus,
button:focus,
select:focus,
<vb:comment>vBulletin pseudo link & button classes</vb:comment>
.js-link:focus,
.js-button:focus,
<vb:comment>A few additional classes</vb:comment>
.b-button:focus,
.ui-state-focus,
.custom-dropdown:focus,
<vb:comment>Extra selectors needed to override CKEditor CSS</vb:comment>
.cke_dialog_body .cke_dialog_contents .b-button:focus {
	outline: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar body_link_color.color};
}

<vb:comment>Drag and drop upload</vb:comment>
.fileupload-dropzone-overlay {
	position: absolute;
	top: 0;
	right: 0;
	bottom: 0;
	left: 0;
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
	background: {vb:stylevar contententry_dropzone_background};
	opacity: 0.9;
	border: {vb:stylevar contententry_dropzone_border};
	color: {vb:stylevar contententry_dropzone_text_color};
	box-sizing: border-box;
	display: flex;
	justify-content: center;
	align-items: center;
	font-size: 2rem;
	line-height: 100%;
	z-index: 999999;
}
.fileupload-dropzone-overlay--active {
	background: {vb:stylevar contententry_dropzone_background_hover};
}
.fileupload-dropzone-ckeditor-overlay {
	position: absolute;
	top: 0;
	right: 0;
	bottom: 0;
	left: 0;
	width: 100%;
	height: 100%;
	background: transparent;
	z-index: 999999;
}

<vb:comment>
	For the vbchat window primarily.  Intended to make sure the "no permissions" display
	looks okay with the bare header/footer.  We should expand that to any other "message page"
	displays.
</vb:comment>
.message-page-minimal {
	padding-top: 100px;
	height: calc(100vh - 100px);
}

<vb:comment>
	Cross-template css variables.
	These are common values that are meant to be shared across css templates to keep certain
	dimensions consistent.
	We may want to push them to stylevar instead if the need arises to make them admin-configurable.
	Prefixed with --main- for "main", i.e. variables that can be referenced in css templates that are
	part of the "main.css" rollup (see cssrollup_vbulletin.xml).
</vb:comment>
:root {
	--main-input-height: 32px;
	--button-border-radius: 3px;
	<vb:comment>
		Standard vB6 default spacings
		xs: 4px
		s: 8px
		m: 16px;
		l: 24px;
		xl: 32px;
	</vb:comment>
	--margin-xs: {vb:stylevar spacing_margin_xs.top, withUnits};
	--padding-xs: {vb:stylevar spacing_padding_xs.top, withUnits};
	--margin-s: {vb:stylevar spacing_margin_s.top, withUnits};
	--padding-s: {vb:stylevar spacing_padding_s.top, withUnits};
	--margin-m: {vb:stylevar spacing_margin_xl.top, withUnits};
	--padding-m: {vb:stylevar spacing_padding_xl.top, withUnits};
	--margin-l: {vb:stylevar spacing_margin_xxl.top, withUnits};
	--padding-l: {vb:stylevar spacing_padding_xxl.top, withUnits};
	--margin-xl: 32px;
	--padding-xl: 32px;

	--form-input-line-height: 1.4;

}

<vb:comment>
	CSS Overrides -- There are a few bits here and there from other css files that need to be overriden from the base style.
	We can override the entire CSS template but that bloats the shim.  We can put stuff in css_additional but that's intended
	for users to override css in a simple way and making them integrate our changes into their defeats the purpose.  So let's
	stick them here.
</vb:comment>

.b-comment .b-divider {
	display: none;
}

.b-comments {
	margin-top: inherit !important;
}

.faqs{

	--padding-s: 8px;

	--padding-m: 16px;

}

<vb:comment>
	This is a bit of a hack but the menu box needs to have a width in it because it uses
	absolute positioning, which causes the normal default calculations based on parent
	elements to fail.  Previously we could rely on the iframe to profide an "inherent"
	width but the div we've replace it with ends up too narrow.  We don't want to set
	the width globally because we want to use the template in other contexts (for
	example in a sidebar template module) and have it adapt properly.

	The width here was choses empiricly to avoid changing the appearance of the main
	login menu.  I'm not sure where the width of the original iframe came from since it
	mostly seems to depend on the page contents rather than a specific setting.
</vb:comment>
.b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item .login-form-main-container {
	width: 290px;
}

.login-form-main-container {
	margin: 0;
	padding: 10px 5px 5px 5px;
	white-space:normal;
	font-size: 1.3rem;
}

.login-form-main-container .tr .td {
	width:10%;
	padding-bottom:10px;
}

input.badlogin {
	background: {vb:stylevar main_nav_login_error_field_background};
	border-color: {vb:stylevar global_palette_warning_01};
	border-width: 2px;
	filter: none;
}

.login-form-main-container .secondary-controls {
	width: 40%;
	font-size: 1.1rem;
}

.login-form-main-container .secondary-controls input {
	vertical-align:bottom;
	margin:0 3px;
	margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0;
}

.login-form-main-container  .lost-password-link {
	display: block;
	line-height: 1.4rem;
	margin-top: 5px;
	margin-bottom:5px;
}

.login-form-main-container .primary-controls {
	text-align:center;
}

.login-form-main-container .primary-controls a {
	font-weight:bold;
}

.login-form-main-container .primary-controls .b-button--primary {
	display:block;
	margin:0 0 10px;
}

.login-message-box .h-center-container {
	width:100%;
	height:100%;
}

<vb:comment>This needs to match the hieght of the login icons</vb:comment>
.login-external-label {
	line-height:24px;	
}

<vb:comment>responsive:css - media queries:general media queries
/* remove link to edit picture modals */</vb:comment>
.profile-media-upload{display:none;}
html.fileinput .profile-media-upload{display:block;}


<vb:comment>/* Customize My Theme panels */</vb:comment>
@media only screen and (max-width:900px) {

	.profile_custom_edit .profileEditContent > ul.profileNavOuter {
		display:block;
		width:auto;
		float:none;
		margin:0 10px;
		border-radius:0;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Apply clearfix */</vb:comment>
	ul.profileNavOuter:before,ul.profileNavOuter:after {content:" "; display:table;}
	ul.profileNavOuter:after{clear:both;}

	.profileNavTabs .profileNavOuter li {
		float:{vb:stylevar left};
		width: auto;
		height: auto;
		margin: 0 1px;
		margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0;
	}

	.ui-tabs .ui-tabs-nav li.ui-tabs-active{padding-bottom:0;}
	.profile_custom_edit .profileEditContent > .profileNavOuter li a {
		display: inline-block;
		width: auto;
		height: auto;
		padding: 5px 12px;
		border-top-{vb:stylevar left}-radius: 3px;
		border-bottom-{vb:stylevar left}-radius: 0;
		border-top-{vb:stylevar right}-radius: 3px;
		border-bottom-{vb:stylevar right}-radius: 0;
	}

	.profile_custom_edit .profileEditContent > .profileNavOuter li a span{display:inline;}
	.profileNavTabs .profileEditContent > .tab {margin:0 10px 10px !important;}
	.profile_custom_edit .profileEditContent >  .ui-widget-content {
		border-top-{vb:stylevar left}-radius: 0;
		border-bottom-{vb:stylevar left}-radius: 3px;
		border-top-{vb:stylevar right}-radius: 0;
		border-bottom-{vb:stylevar right}-radius: 3px;
	}

	.profile_custom_edit .profileEditContent > div .ui-widget-content{padding: 10px !important;}
}

@media only screen and (max-width:420px) {

	.profile_custom_edit .profileEditContent > .profileNavOuter li a {
		padding: 5px 8px;
	}

}

@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {
	.forum_disabled_wrapper {
		padding: 10px 10px 0 10px;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* forgot password page */</vb:comment>
	#frmLostpw .stretch{margin-{vb:stylevar left}:10px;}
	#frmLostpw div:first-child{width:95%;}

}

<vb:comment>
/* header elements: remove edit, resize logo */
/* Delta: 16 px, 555px here is same as 539px in body width() */
/*@media only screen and (max-width:440px) {#header .site-logo img{width:170%;}}*/
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:440px) {
	<vb:comment>/* #header .site-logo img{width:80%;} */</vb:comment>
	#header .site-logo.header-edit-box{padding-{vb:stylevar left}:8px;padding-{vb:stylevar right}:8px}
}

<vb:comment>/* @media only screen and (max-width:767px) {.widget-content{font-size:.92em}} */</vb:comment>



<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   General responsiveness
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

  img {
    max-width: 100%;
    height: auto;
  }



<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Body and wrappers
   ========================================================================== */

/**
* Our overriding goal here is to allow a range of flexible widths between
* a minimum and maximum size.
*/
</vb:comment>

#outer-wrapper {
  margin: {vb:stylevar wrapper_margin};
}

@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {
  #outer-wrapper {
    margin: 0;
  }
}


<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Content
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {
  #content {
    /* Bump down the margins to make more space for content */
    padding-{vb:stylevar left}:  10px;
    padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
  }
}

<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Columns
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

.canvas-layout-row .no-columns { display: none; }


<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Header
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>
<vb:comment>987px is to match the js-defined vB.small breakpoint</vb:comment>
@media only screen and (max-width:987px) {
  #header .toolbar {display:none}
}
@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {

  #header .site-logo {padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 20px;}

<vb:comment>
	/* Bring this under 320px or you get side-scrolling on iPhone portrait mode. */
</vb:comment>
  #header .header-cell {min-width:300px;}

}

@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {
  #vb-page-body .main-header,
  .view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.profile-settings-widget .widget-header .module-title {
    <vb:comment>/* Reduce the font size at narrower screen width */</vb:comment>
    font-size: 2.4rem;
    line-height: 2.4rem;
    padding: 5px 0 10px;
  }
  #header .site-logo {
    padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px;
  }
}

@media only screen and (max-width:320px) {

  #vb-page-body .main-header,
  .view-mode .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.profile-settings-widget .widget-header .module-title {
    font-size: 2rem;
    line-height: 2rem;
  }

  #header .site-logo {padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px;}
}


<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Header Logo
   ========================================================================== */

/**
* In a change from the way we've been doing responsive, for the logo image,
* we're going to try to constrain its _height_, based on the height of
* the viewport. */

#header .site-logo img {
  /* Let's just cap the max logo image height in all cases. */
  /* max-height: 100px; */
}
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-height: 480px) {
  <vb:comment>/* iPhone portrait mode */</vb:comment>
  #header .site-logo img {
    max-height: 40px;
    width: auto;
  }
  <vb:comment>/* Let's also reduce the padding of the enclosing container */</vb:comment>
  #header .site-logo {
    padding-top: 14px;
    padding-bottom: 16px;
  }
}

@media only screen and (max-height: 320px) {
  <vb:comment>
  /* iPhone landscape mode (shorter than portrait mode, of course) */
  </vb:comment>
  #header .site-logo img {
    max-height: 32px;
    width: auto;
  }
  <vb:comment>
  /* Reduce the padding of the enclosing container even further */
  </vb:comment>
  #header .site-logo {
    padding-top: 10px;
    padding-bottom: 12px;
  }

}



<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Notices
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {
	.notices {
		padding: 10px 10px 0 10px;
	}
}

<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Filter bar
   ========================================================================== */

/* Selected filters bar on Forum Topic page
   ========================================================================== */

</vb:comment>
@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {
  /* Selected Filters bar */
  .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .filtered-by {
    /* Full-sized version was height set to 18px, so make that the min-height */
    min-height: 1.8rem;
    /* Let it set its own normal height */
    height: auto;
    /* Make a few adjustments to make it look right */
    padding: 3px 10px;
    line-height: 2rem;
  }

<vb:comment>
  /**
   * Make sure the words "Clear All" break together to the next line
   * if necessary.
   */
</vb:comment>
  .filtered-by .clear-all { display: inline-block; }
}



@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {

<vb:comment>
/* Responsive Filter menu
   ==========================================================================
   *
   * This is a first attempt to make a palatable responsive filter
   * menu at smaller sizes. We change the vertical columns to
   * horizontal rows and let the options simply run inline. */
</vb:comment>
  .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay,
  .toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay {
    padding: 0;
	<vb:comment>
	For mobile, don't right-align to the button, and just let it expand all the way.
	Note that on mobile, the toolbar is no longer sticky and users can scroll up and down on the
	filter menu, so it's a whole different UX.
	</vb:comment>
	--js-filter-menu-right: 0 !important;
  }

  .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay .filter-options-list > li,
  .toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay .filter-options-list > li  {
    padding: 10px;
    border-{vb:stylevar left}: none;
    border-top: 1px dotted {vb:stylevar toolbar_dropdown_divider_color};
	<vb:comment>
	in mobile the menu becomes vertical. Make each options block 100% width so the dotted border
	goes all the way across.
	</vb:comment>
	width: 100%;
  }

  .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay .filter-options-list > li:first-child,
  .toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay .filter-options-list > li:first-child {
    border-top: none;
  }

  .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay .filter-options-list > li label,
  .toolbar-wrapper .toolbar-filter-overlay .filter-options-list > li label {
    display: inline-block;
    margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 1em;
  }


}

<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Forum Directory tab
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:768px) {
	<vb:comment>
	/**
	 * Display list of subforums in one column instead of three.
	 */
	</vb:comment>
	.forum-list-container .subforum-list .subforum-item {
		display: block;
		padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 0;
	}
	.forum-list-container .subforum-list .subforum-item .subforum-info {
		float: none;
	}
	.forum-list-container .subforum-list .subforum-item .counts {
		display: none;
	}
}




@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {

	<vb:comment>/* START Forum list on home page */</vb:comment>

	<vb:comment>/* Hide the Latest Post column */</vb:comment>
	.forum-list-container .forum-list-header .header-topics,
	.forum-list-container .forum-list-header .header-posts,
	.forum-list-container .forum-list-header .header-lastpost,
	.forum-list-container .forum-item .cell-forum .forum-desc,
	.forum-list-container .forum-item .topics-count,
	.forum-list-container .forum-item .posts-count,
	.forum-list-container .forum-item .lastpost {
		display: none;
	}

	.forum-list-container .forum-item td.cell-forum {
		padding: 8px 10px;
	}

	.forum-list-container .forum-item .cell-forum .forum-wrapper .forum-info,
	.forum-list-container .forum-item .cell-forum .forum-wrapper .forum-info .forum-title {
		display: inline;
		padding: 0;
	}

	.forum-list-container .forum-item .cell-forum .rx-forum-stats,
	.forum-list-container .forum-item .cell-forum .rx-lastpost-info {
		color: {vb:stylevar content_list_secondary_text_color};
		display: block;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Add border to the right of the Posts column which is now the last column as a result of hiding the Latest Post column */</vb:comment>
	.forum-list-container .forum-list-header .header-posts {
		border-{vb:stylevar right}:{vb:stylevar primary_module_subheader_border};
	}

	<vb:comment>	/* We don't want the view count to wrap, better to have it break to the next line all together */</vb:comment>
	.forum-list-container .viewer {
		white-space: nowrap;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* END Forum list on home page */</vb:comment>
}





<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Forum Topic
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {
  .list-container .list-item .list-item-body { padding: 10px; }
  #thread-view-tab .post-footer .content-tags { margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px; }

<vb:comment>
  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header {
    /* padding-top: 15px; */
  }
</vb:comment>

}

@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {
  <vb:comment>/* Stack the thread view conversation components */</vb:comment>
  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .userinfo {
    width: 100%;
    float: none;
    display: block;
    text-align:{vb:stylevar left};
    padding: 10px 10px 16px;
    box-sizing: border-box;
  }

<vb:comment>
  /* Put a clearfix in only when we get down to this width */
  /* http://nicolasgallagher.com/micro-clearfix-hack/ */
</vb:comment>
  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .userinfo:before,
  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .userinfo:after {
    content: " ";
    display: table;
  }

  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .userinfo:after {
    clear: both;
  }


  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .list-item-body-wrapper {
    width: 100%;
    float: none;
    display: block;
    margin: 0;
  }

<vb:comment>
  /**
   * Reposition the pointer from the left side to the top of the
   * container, rotating it in the process.
   */
</vb:comment>
  .conversation-content-widget .list-item-body-wrapper .pointer-left {
    <vb:comment>/* Move above and outside the text block */</vb:comment>
    top: -10px;
    <vb:comment>/* Position centered under the avatar */</vb:comment>
    {vb:stylevar left}: 39px;
    -webkit-transform: rotate(90deg);
    -moz-transform: rotate(90deg);
    transform: rotate(90deg);
  }

  .conversation-content-widget .thread-view .post-footer-wrapper .post-footer .divider,
  .conversation-content-widget .post-footer-wrapper .post-footer .divider {
    margin: 0;
  }

  <vb:comment>/* Remove moderation checkbox */</vb:comment>
  .thread-view .inlinemod-item .checkbox { display: none; }


<vb:comment>
  /**
   * In general, we are trying to collapse the elements of .userinfo into a
   * single line where possible, breaking onto a second line where necessary.
   */
</vb:comment>

  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .userinfo .avatar {
    float:{vb:stylevar left};
    margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
  }

  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .userinfo .author {
    margin-top: 0;
    margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
	overflow-wrap: break-word;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }

  .userinfo .reputation {
    margin-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
    padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 0;
  }

  .conversation-content-widget .list-container.thread-view .list-item .list-item-body-wrapper .list-item-body {
    padding-top: 10px;
    padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px;
    padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
  }

<vb:comment>
  /**
   * Having these items position themselves like TDs with content vertically
   * aligned in the center and no padding whatsoever creates problems when the
   * content breaks to a second line -- that element's text will butt up
   * against the top edge of the container. Here we're merely adding a little
   * breathing room to ensure against that.
   */
</vb:comment>
  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .info,
  .conversation-content-widget .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .post-header.table .post-action-wrapper.td {
    padding-top: 5px;
  }


  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .post-header {
    width: auto;
	margin-left: 52px;
    float: none;
  }

  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .post-header .post-action-wrapper {
    width: auto;
  }

  .post-header .channel-info {
    display: inline;
    display: inline-block;
  }

  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .h-right {
    width: 100%;
    clear: both;
    display: block;
    height: auto;
    line-height: 1em;
    padding: 0 0 15px;
    margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 10px;
  }

  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .info .post-date {
    float:{vb:stylevar left};
    margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 45px;
  }

  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .info .subscribed  {
    clear: none;
    display: inline-block;
  }

  .conversation-list.stream-view .list-item-header .post-header.table {
    height: auto;
  }
}

@media only screen and (max-width:320px) {
  .post-footer-wrapper .post-footer ul li{margin-{vb:stylevar left}:6px;}
}


<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   New Topic form
   ========================================================================== */

/* General-purpose rules that prevent the file upload
* button and text from displaying if Modernizr detects that
* the browser doesn't support input[type=file] */
</vb:comment>

.b-button--upload,
.b-file-chooser__text--filetypes {
	display: none;
}

html.fileinput .b-button--upload,
html.fileinput .b-file-chooser__text--filetypes {
  display: inline;
  display: inline-block;
}




<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Inline Leave a Comment
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:479px) {
  .comment-entry-box {
    padding: 10px 10px 15px;
  }
}


<vb:comment>
/* ==========================================================================
   Canvas widget chrome
   ========================================================================== */
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {

	<vb:comment>The 10px padding and negatigve margin on .canvas-widget and
	.widget-header is in sync with .widget-header-divider</vb:comment>

  .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget:not(.widget-no-border),
  .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget-highlight {
    border: none;
    padding: 0 10px 10px 10px;
    border-radius: 0;
    width: 100%;
  }

  .l-xsmall .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.page-title-widget {
    margin: 10px 0 0 0;
  }

  .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget .widget-content {
    padding-top: 0;
  }

  .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget:not(.widget-no-border) .widget-header {
	<vb:comment>The bottom border and margin is used instead of
	.widget-header-divider</vb:comment>
    border-top:{vb:stylevar module_content_border};
    border-bottom:{vb:stylevar module_content_border};
    margin: 0 -10px 10px -10px;
		border-radius: 0;
  }
  .canvas-layout-container .canvas-widget.collapsed:not(.widget-no-border) {
    padding-bottom: 0;
  }

<vb:comment>responsive:css - media queries:search page</vb:comment>
.search-results-widget .conversation-toolbar.mobile-search-results {display: none;}
@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {

	#advancedSearchFields{padding:0 !important;}
	#rx-tags-column{display:block !important;}
	.form-row-daterange div.field_column {width:300px;min-width:300px;}

	<vb:comment>
	/* search results - mobile view */
	/*
		***important note: existing desktop version of vb5 has layout issues
		if enough characters (19 chars or so) are added to keyword field, keywords control
		on search results page improperly positions search icon
	*/
  </vb:comment>
	.search-result-header .search-controls {margin-bottom:0px;}
	.search-controls .search-control-popup {margin-bottom:10px;display:block;margin-{vb:stylevar left}:0px;}
	.search-controls .search-control-popup .PopupContent {top:22px;}
	.search-controls .search-control-popup span{max-width:250px}
	.search-results-widget .widget-content,
	.search-results-widget .widget-content .search-result-header,
	.search-results-widget .widget-content  .conversation-toolbar-wrapper{display:block;float:none;clear:both}
	.search-results-widget .conversation-toolbar-wrapper .conversation-toolbar .toolset-left > li {margin-{vb:stylevar right}:5px;}
	.conversation-toolbar .toolset-left .sort-controls label{display:none;}
	.search-results-widget .conversation-toolbar.desktop .toolset-right {display: none;}
	.search-results-widget .conversation-toolbar.mobile-search-results {display: block;}

}

@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {

	<vb:comment>/* restyle all labels */</vb:comment>
	.add-search-fieldset .label_column
	{
		width:275px !important;
		height:18px !important;
		display:inline-block !important;
		clear:both !important;
		margin-top:20px !important;
		text-align:{vb:stylevar left};
		float:{vb:stylevar left};
	}

	<vb:comment>
	/* restyle all field columns */
	</vb:comment>
	.add-search-fieldset div.field_column{float:{vb:stylevar left};display:block;}
	.add-search-fieldset div.field_column label{float:{vb:stylevar left};max-width:250px;width:250px;}
	.add-search-fieldset div.field_column label input,
	.add-search-fieldset div.field_column label img{float:{vb:stylevar right};}

	<vb:comment>
	/* search header */
	</vb:comment>
	.search-fields-widget .widget-header{padding-{vb:stylevar left}:0px !important;}

	<vb:comment>
	/* search: keywords */
	/* restyle TITLE ONLY checkbox */
	</vb:comment>
	.form-row-keywords .field_column,.form-row-members .field_column{padding:0 !important;}
	.form-row-keywords .info_column,.form-row-members .info_column{padding:0 !important;clear:both !important;float:{vb:stylevar left};text-align:{vb:stylevar left};}
	<vb:comment>/* restyle SEARCH TIPS */</vb:comment>
	a.search-tips{margin-top:2px !important;}

	.form-row-daterange div.field_column label.date-from{float:{vb:stylevar left};}
	.form-row-daterange div.field_column label.date-to{float:{vb:stylevar left};margin:0px !important;}
	.form-row-daterange div.field_column label.date-lastvisit input{float:{vb:stylevar left};}

	<vb:comment>/* search page: tags */</vb:comment>
	.form_layout .form-fieldset .form_row.form-row-tags .field_column .tag-editor-wrapper .add-tag-link {top:0;}
	<vb:comment>/* search page: tags modal dialog */</vb:comment>
	.form-row-tags > .field_column{padding-bottom:0px !important;}

	<vb:comment>/* search page: date inputs */</vb:comment>
	.form-row-daterange .field_column .date-from,
	.form-row-daterange .field_column .date-to{float:{vb:stylevar right};margin-bottom:5px;}
	input.searchFields_from_date,
	input.searchFields_to_date {margin-{vb:stylevar left}:8px !important;width:150px !important;}

	<vb:comment>
	/* sort by, order */
	</vb:comment>
	.add-search-fieldset .form-row-sortby div.field_column{padding-bottom:0px !important;}
	.add-search-fieldset .label_column.sort-order{margin-top:0px !important;padding-top:0px !important;}
	.searchFields_order_field,.searchFields_order_direction{margin-bottom:5px;}

}

<vb:comment>responsive:css - media queries:blogs page:incrementally shrink and remove elements</vb:comment>

<vb:comment>
/*
	As viewport shrinks the following breakpoints alter the display of, or hide,
	elements in the filter (conversation-toolbar) and blogs sub menu (ui-tabs-nav)

	@1150	reduce size of "All" button
	@1025	hide "Show:" label
	@860	hide "My Blog Posts" button in filter, hide "Member Blogs" link in blogs menu
	@767	parent container expands, re-display "My Blog Posts" button and "Show:" label

	note: These paths are specific to blogs and social groups in the path of a column with the
		style "l-col__fixed-6".	The l-col__fixed-6 class replaced the bootstrap class span4.
		This class makes these controls too small to display all elements at certain widths.
		To limit the number of regressions introduced (VBV-9543), find/replace was used here.

*/
</vb:comment>
@media only screen and (max-width:1150px) {

	<vb:comment>/* reduce size of "All" button */</vb:comment>
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__fixed-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left button.showAll{min-width:50px;min-width:50px;}

}

@media only screen and (max-width:1025px) {

	<vb:comment>/* hide "Show:" label */</vb:comment>
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__fixed-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left > li > .button-set > .b-button__text-primary {display:none;}

}

@media only screen and (max-width:860px) {

	<vb:comment>/* hide "My Blog Posts" button */</vb:comment>
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__fixed-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left button.showMy{display:none;}

	<vb:comment>/* hide "Member Blogs" link */</vb:comment>
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__fixed-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-header > .module-title > .ui-widget-header > li > a[href="#memberblog-tab"]{display:none;}

}


@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {

	<vb:comment>
	/* re-display "My Blog Posts" button and "Show:" label */
	</vb:comment>
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__fixed-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left button.showMy{display:inline-block}
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__fixed-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left > li > .button-set > .b-button__text-primary {display:inline-block;}

}

<vb:comment>
/*
	As viewport shrinks the following breakpoints alter the display of, or hide,
	elements in the filter (conversation-toolbar) and blogs sub menu (ui-tabs-nav)

	@1150	reduce size of "All" button
	@1025	hide "Show:" label
	@860	hide "My Blog Posts" button in filter, hide "Member Blogs" link in blogs menu
	@767	parent container expands, re-display "My Blog Posts" button and "Show:" label

	note: These paths are specific to blogs and social groups in the path of a column with the
		style "l-col__flex-6".	The l-col__flex-6 class replaced the bootstrap class span8.
		This class makes these controls too small to display all elements at certain widths.
		To limit the number of regressions introduced (VBV-9543), find/replace was used here.

*/
</vb:comment>

@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {

	<vb:comment>/* re-display "My Blog Posts" button and "Show:" label */</vb:comment>
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__flex-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left button.showMy{display:inline-block}
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__flex-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left > li > .button-set > .b-button__text-primary {display:inline-block;}

}

@media only screen and (max-width:400px) {

	<vb:comment>/* reduce size of "All" button */</vb:comment>
	.canvas-layout-row > .canvas-widget-list.l-col__flex-6 > .canvas-widget >
	.widget-tabs-panel > .ui-widget-content > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper >
	.conversation-toolbar > .toolset-left button.showAll{min-width:75px;min-width:75px;}

}

<vb:comment>
/* Photo Carousel: iPhone landscape */
</vb:comment>
@media only screen and (max-width:480px) {

<vb:comment>
	.slideshow {padding:0px !important;background:{vb:stylevar photo_background};}
	.slideshow .slideshow-wrapper > .jcarousel-clip-horizontal {width:421px;height:200px;}
	.slideshow .thumbnails > .jcarousel-clip-horizontal {width:344px;height:52px;}/*width:234px*/
	.slideshow .slideshow-wrapper > .jcarousel-clip .jcarousel-item {width:421px;height:200px;}
	.slideshow .thumbnails > .jcarousel-clip .jcarousel-item {width:70px;height:52px;overflow:hidden;}
	.slideshow .jcarousel-item .image {max-width:300px;max-height:200px;width:auto;height:auto;}

	body > div.slideshow-dialog{width:421px !important;height:357px !important;}
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow {height:357px !important;width:421px !important;}
	div.slideshow-wrapper > div.jcarousel-next,div.slideshow-wrapper > div.jcarousel-prev {top:80px !important;}
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow-wrapper.jcarousel-container.jcarousel-container-horizontal > div.jcarousel-clip.jcarousel-clip-horizontal
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow-wrapper.jcarousel-container.jcarousel-container-horizontal > div.jcarousel-clip.jcarousel-clip-horizontal > ul > li.jcarousel-item,
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow-wrapper.jcarousel-container.jcarousel-container-horizontal > div.jcarousel-clip.jcarousel-clip-horizontal > ul > li.jcarousel-item > div.image-wrapper{width:421px !important;}
</vb:comment>

}

<vb:comment>
/* Photo Carousel: iPhone portrait */
</vb:comment>
@media only screen and (max-width:320px) {

<vb:comment>
	.slideshow {padding:0px !important;background:{vb:stylevar photo_background};}
	.slideshow .slideshow-wrapper > .jcarousel-clip-horizontal {width:311px;height:200px;}
	.slideshow .thumbnails > .jcarousel-clip-horizontal {width:250px;height:52px;}/*234*/
	.slideshow .slideshow-wrapper > .jcarousel-clip .jcarousel-item {width:311px;height:200px;}
	.slideshow .thumbnails > .jcarousel-clip .jcarousel-item {width:70px;height:52px;overflow:hidden;}
	.slideshow .jcarousel-item .image {max-width:300px;max-height:200px;width:auto;height:auto;}

	body > div.slideshow-dialog{width:311px !important;height:357px !important;}
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow {height:357px !important;width:311px !important;}
	div.slideshow-wrapper > div.jcarousel-next,div.slideshow-wrapper > div.jcarousel-prev {top:80px !important;}
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow-wrapper.jcarousel-container.jcarousel-container-horizontal > div.jcarousel-clip.jcarousel-clip-horizontal
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow-wrapper.jcarousel-container.jcarousel-container-horizontal > div.jcarousel-clip.jcarousel-clip-horizontal > ul > li.jcarousel-item,
	body > div.slideshow-dialog > div.slideshow-wrapper.jcarousel-container.jcarousel-container-horizontal > div.jcarousel-clip.jcarousel-clip-horizontal > ul > li.jcarousel-item > div.image-wrapper{width:311px !important;}
</vb:comment>

}

	#canvas-layout-narrow-wide .canvas-widget-list.section-0 .activity-stream-widget .forum-list-container .forum-item .topics-count {

<vb:comment>
	/* remove middle columns and widen outer columns for better iPhone portrait display */
</vb:comment>
	@media only screen and (max-width:767px) {

	}




	<vb:comment>
	/*
	 * Topic List
	 *
	 * We're in a transtional state to getting the CSS organized. For now, I'm grouping these .l-small rules
	 * here to go with the replace the max-width:479px media query they were a part of. VBV-9793
	 * These are .topic-list-container rules.
	 */
	</vb:comment>

	<vb:comment>/* Table */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container,
	.l-small .topic-list-container {
		display: block;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Header row */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list-header,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list-header {
		display: block;
	}
	<vb:comment>/* Hide the title in search module results when display as topics is chosen */</vb:comment>
	.search-widget .topic-list-container .topic-list-header {
		display: none;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-topic-image,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-icons,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-stats,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-topic-image,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-icons,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-stats,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-lastpost {
		display:none;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list-header,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list-header {
		border-left:{vb:stylevar primary_module_subheader_border};
		border-right:{vb:stylevar primary_module_subheader_border};
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-topic,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list-header .header-topic {
		padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 15px;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Table rows */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list {
		display: block;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item {
		<vb:comment>/* Needed to position .cell-inlinemod-item */</vb:comment>
		display: block;
		position: relative;
		overflow: auto;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Base style for table cells */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic-image,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-inlinemod-item,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic-image,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-inlinemod-item {
		padding: 0 5px;
		display: block;
		box-sizing: border-box;
		color: {vb:stylevar content_list_text_color};
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-inlinemod-item,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list.sticky-list + .topic-list tr:first-child td.cell-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list.sticky-list + .topic-list tr:first-child td.cell-lastpost,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list.sticky-list + .topic-list tr:first-child td.cell-inlinemod-item,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-inlinemod-item,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list.sticky-list + .topic-list tr:first-child td.cell-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list.sticky-list + .topic-list tr:first-child td.cell-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list.sticky-list + .topic-list tr:first-child td.cell-inlinemod-item {
		border-top: none;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Topic image cell */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic-image,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic-image {
		float: {vb:stylevar left};
		clear: {vb:stylevar left};
		padding-top: 10px;
		padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 10px;
		box-sizing: content-box;
		margin-bottom: 10px;
		<vb:comment>Keep above the title element so clicking triggers the open/close feature instead of the title edit feature.</vb:comment>
		position: relative;
		z-index: 1;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Title cell */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-topic {
		padding-top: 10px;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.unapproved .cell-topic,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.deleted .cell-topic,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.unapproved .cell-topic,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.deleted .cell-topic {
		padding-bottom: 10px;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item .cell-topic .topic-wrapper,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item .cell-topic .topic-wrapper {
		box-sizing: border-box;
		width:100%;
		font-size: 1.2em;
		line-height: 1.1em;
		margin-{vb:stylevar left}: 0;
		margin-bottom: 2px;
		padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 22px;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item .cell-topic .topic-info,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item .cell-topic .topic-info {
		display: none;
	}


	<vb:comment>/* Icon cell */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-icons,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-icons {
		display:none;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Count cell */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count {
		font-size: 0.9em;
		padding-bottom: 2px;
		padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 5px;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count .posts-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count .views-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count .votes-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count .posts-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count .views-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-count .votes-count {
		display: inline;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Last post cell */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item td.cell-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item td.cell-lastpost {
		font-size: 0.9em;
		padding-{vb:stylevar left}: 5px;
		padding-{vb:stylevar right}: 5px;
		padding-top: 0;
		padding-bottom: 10px;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost .avatar,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost .lastpost-by,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost .avatar,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost .lastpost-by {
		display: none;
	}
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost .post-date,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-lastpost .post-date {
		font-size: inherit;
		color: {vb:stylevar content_list_secondary_text_color};
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Handle redirect, deleted, and unapproved */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.redirect .cell-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.redirect .cell-lastpost,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.deleted .cell-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.deleted .cell-lastpost,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.unapproved .cell-count,
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.unapproved .cell-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.redirect .cell-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.redirect .cell-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.deleted .cell-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.deleted .cell-lastpost,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.unapproved .cell-count,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .topic-item.unapproved .cell-lastpost {
		display: none;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* Inline mod cell -- Note: inline moderation is completely hidden elsewhere in this file at the smallest screen sizes */</vb:comment>
	.l-narrow-column .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-inlinemod-item,
	.l-small .topic-list-container .topic-list .cell-inlinemod-item {
		padding-top: 10px;
		width: 30px;
		position: absolute;
		top: 3px;
		{vb:stylevar right}: 3px;
	}

	<vb:comment>/* END Topic List */</vb:comment>




	/*
	 * The statistics UI also uses the .table, .tr, and .td classes. We need !important here because the
	 * ".table .td" rule also uses !important for display: table-cell.
	 */
	.l-small .sg-statistics, .l-small .blogChannel-statistics{display:none !important;}


	<vb:comment>
	/* encapsulate debug info */
	</vb:comment>
	.l-small #debug-information {
		box-sizing: border-box;
		overflow: auto;
		width: 280px;
		max-width: 280px;
	}

</vb:comment>

		.b-layout--contiguous .subscriptions-widget .widget-content .subscribeTabs .subscription-list-container .subscription-list .subscription-item .td.second_column{padding-left:7px !important;padding-right:0px !important;}

<vb:comment>
	/**
	 *
	 *	conversation toolbar
	 *	style for mobile versus desktop
	 *
	 **/
</vb:comment>
	@media only screen and (max-width:990px) {

		<vb:comment>
		/* hide  left (button) container and search - both copied and displayed on new toolbar row */
		</vb:comment>
		.conversation-view > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper > .conversation-toolbar.desktop > ul.toolset-left{display:none;}

		<vb:comment>
		/* resize pagination arrows */
		</vb:comment>
		.conversation-view > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper > .conversation-toolbar.desktop > ul.toolset-right > li.toolbar-pagenav div.horizontal-arrows{width:112px;}
		.conversation-view > .conversation-toolbar-wrapper > .conversation-toolbar.desktop > ul.toolset-right > li.toolbar-pagenav div.horizontal-arrows a{width:55px;}
		.widget-tabs-panel .conversation-toolbar-wrapper > .conversation-toolbar > ul.toolset-right > li.toolbar-pagenav div.horizontal-arrows{width:82px;}
		.widget-tabs-panel .conversation-toolbar-wrapper > .conversation-toolbar > ul.toolset-right > li.toolbar-pagenav div.horizontal-arrows a{width:35px;}
		ul.toolset.h-right > li.pagenav-controls div.horizontal-arrows{width:71px;} 	<vb:comment>/* profile notifications: arrows 35px wide, x2 = 70px + 1px border = 71px */</vb:comment>
		ul.toolset.h-right > li.pagenav-controls div.horizontal-arrows a{width:35px;}
		ul.toolset.h-right > li.pagenav-controls div.horizontal-arrows a:first-child {
			border: 0;
		}

	}

.h-prevent-scroll-v {
	height: 100%;
	overflow: hidden;
	/*position: relative;*/
}

  • Phrases don't play nice the parameters due to a long standing bug, so use a hidden field instead of a meta tag here {vb:phrase home} {vb:schema meta, position, 1}
    • {vb:set crumbTitle, {vb:rawphrase {vb:raw crumb.phrase}}} {vb:set crumbTitle, {vb:raw crumb.title}} Home page gets a breadcrumb item with no title. Keeping old behavior for now while getting rid of template notice. See VBV-17080 & VBV-17079 {vb:set crumbTitle, ''}
  • {vb:raw crumbTitle} {vb:raw crumbTitle} {vb:schema meta, position, {vb:math {vb:var index} + 2}}
We still need the #breadcrumbs element (even though empty) to avoid having multiple CSS rules to deal with different scenarios where adjacent elements - breadcrumbs, channel-subtabbar, notices are available, visible, hidden or empty. Used div instead of ul to prevent having an empty ul which is invalid in XHTML 1.0 Strict (though valid in HTML5). Though we are currently using HTML5 doctype, using an emtpy div will ensure that this will validate even if we change the doctype in the future.
{vb:hook 'header_before_notices'} Ideally we should be able to extend this logic to any kind of headlinks on every page but limitting to display only the ones declared as rss link {vb:set linkurl, {vb:raw baseurl}} {vb:strcat linkurl, {vb:raw link.href}} {vb:headlink rel={vb:var link.rel}, title={vb:var link.title}, type={vb:var link.type}, href={vb:raw linkurl}}

templategroup.name: vB Messenger
templategroup.template:
{vb:set messagesCount, {vb:raw headerCounts.messages}} {vb:set messagesCount, 0}
  • Label text may be removed in Responsive based on the .js-pmchat__messages-label class. {vb:phrase vbmessenger_header} {vb:number {vb:var messagesCount}}
    • {vb:set urlInfo.action, 'index'} {vb:phrase go_to_new_chat}
    • {vb:set urlInfo.action, 'index'} {vb:phrase go_to_message_center}
      • Keeping the loading icon below any link items as to minimize chances to accidentally moving stuff around while user is trying to click on them.

We expect one of conversation OR $to_user. If both are provided we'll ignore to_user array|object $user Required, but provided globally. This is the current user object set globally for templates, and must have int 'userid'. array $conversation (Optional) For pre-filling the new private message about a content node $conversation, this array must have int 'userid', string 'username', string 'displayname', int 'channelid' & int 'nodeid' of the content node. array $to_user (Optional) For pre-filling the new private message with a participant. Must have int 'userid', string 'username', & string 'displayname'. boolean $force_mail_icon True if we should show the mail icon even if PMChat isn't available. We may want this generally but it would be a change of behavior for the forum posts. {vb:set to_userinfo, {vb:raw conversation.userinfo}} {vb:set to_userinfo, {vb:raw to_user}} We want to show an icon unless 1) PMChat is disabled for this user *AND* we don't always show at least the mail icon in this context OR 2) The target user is guest or otherwise an invalid user id OR 3) The target user is the current user (we don't ever want to prompt a user to message themselves) OR 4) This is a conversation in the PM channel (PMing people about PMs is weird -- just reply). {vb:set showIcon, 1} {vb:set showIcon, 0} {vb:data pm_channel, node, fetchPMChannel} {vb:set showIcon, {vb:if "$conversation['channelid'] != $pm_channel", 1, 0}} If recipient is receiving PM & has pmchat enabled, show the pmchat icon. If recipient is receiving PMs but has pmchat off, show the legacy privatemessage icon If recipient has PMs disabled, do not show any icons. This is weird. But legacy usage we always display the PM Chat icon in some cases. We need to figure out how to consistantly fetch and pass the PM status, but in case we don't have the fields set then we need to assume we should show the icons {vb:set routeExtras, {vb:php array}} {vb:set routeExtras.aboutNodeid, {vb:var conversation.nodeid}} {vb:set routeExtras.toUserid, {vb:var to_userinfo.userid}}

templategroup.name: Top Menu
templategroup.template:
** Granular Notification Counts **
  • Label text may be removed in Responsive based on the .js-header__notifications-label class. {vb:phrase {vb:raw headerCounts.titlephrase}} {vb:number {vb:raw headerCounts.totalcount}}
      The reason .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--unread is set by default here rather than contingent on $details['count'] is because we're going to be hiding the whole row if there is no count, and if vB Messenger is enabled, show the row if the relevant info was updated. It's not worth toggling the .b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--unread class in javascript, and it'll always be opposite of h-hide-imp (which is toggled by the JS), it's simpler to just always have that on. Also note that due to this hide/show behavior, the "b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--first" class is not reliable unless we re-calculate the shown first in JS every time we update the header counts, so it's been removed. The CSS nowadays handles b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item:first-child anyways. Since we show/hide the entire row, that's also why span.notifications-count does not have .h-hide-imp based on $details['count']. {vb:set li_classes, {vb:concat "b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item b-comp-menu-dropdown__content-item--unread", {vb:if "!empty($detail['count'])", "", " h-hide-imp"} }}
    • {vb:phrase {vb:raw detail.titlephrase}} {vb:number {vb:raw detail.count}}
      • Always link to message center?
    • {vb:set urlInfo.action, 'index'} {vb:phrase go_to_message_center}
      • Keeping the loading icon below any link items as to minimize chances to accidentally moving stuff around while user is trying to click on them.

{vb:set state, ''} ** AdminCP Link **
  • {vb:phrase admincp}
    • ** Empty initial item for one side of the first divider **
  • ** Style Tab ** {vb:data canAdminSettings, user, hasPermissions, adminpermissions, canadminsettings} {vb:data canAdminSettingsAll, user, hasPermissions, adminpermissions, canadminsettingsall} {vb:data canAdminStyles, user, hasPermissions, adminpermissions, canadminstyles} {vb:data canAdminTemplates, user, hasPermissions, adminpermissions, canadmintemplates}
  • {vb:phrase sb_style}
    • ** Channels Tab ** {vb:data canAdminForums, user, hasPermissions, adminpermissions, canadminforums}
  • {vb:phrase channel_manager_label}
    • ** Pages Tab **
  • {vb:phrase sbpanel_pagelist_label}
    • ** New Page Tab **
  • {vb:phrase new_page}
    • ** Edit Page Tab **
  • {vb:phrase edit_page}
    • ** Header Tab **
  • {vb:phrase header}
    • ** Navbar Tab **
  • {vb:phrase navigation_bar}
    • ** Footer Tab **
  • {vb:phrase footer}
    • ** Quick Setup Tab **

{vb:hook 'header_navright'} *** Logged in user *** ** Empty initial item for one side of the first divider **
  • ** Notifications ** {vb:data headerCounts, content_privatemessage, getHeaderCounts} {vb:data unreadCount, content_privatemessage, getUnreadInboxCount} {vb:data canUsePmSystem, content_privatemessage, canUsePmSystem} {vb:template top_menu_notifications, headerCounts={vb:raw headerCounts}, unreadCount={vb:raw unreadCount}, canUsePmSystem={vb:raw canUsePmSystem} } ** vB Messenger ** {vb:template pmchat_message_header, headerCounts={vb:raw headerCounts}} ** Username menu ** {vb:set data.userid, {vb:raw user.userid}} the classes username-container and label and the id lnkUsernameMenu exist only for automated unit testing. They will be removed in a future release and should not be depended on. Use the js- classes instead.
  • todo: screenreaders read the sequence of avatar & username as "{username} {username}". We may want to add an aria-label that's more explicitly "avatar for {username}" instead to clarify. We probably want to do this globally for all avatars. {vb:data avatar, user, fetchAvatar, {vb:raw user.userid}, true} Label text may be removed in Responsive based on the .js-menu__username-label class. {vb:var user.displayname}
    • {vb:phrase my_profile}

It should be removed (and the classes transfered back to the "a" element) when the menu css is refactored to avoid this {vb:phrase facebook} {vb:hook 'header_topusermenu_external_login'}

is important. The search system uses the context to essentially short circuit a lot of logic that would result in potentially slow joins/filtering/sorting by making the assumption that 1) We only want starters 2) We only *filter* (e.g. contenttype, votes, date-fields, no search terms but hypothetically as well) on starters, NOT replies/comments. 3) We sort by lastcontent {vb:set options.context, 'channeldisplay'} Sticky topics are fetched separately to group and style them differently with non-sticky topics. The same search options except 'exclude_sticky' should also be applied when fetching sticky topics. TODO: Check for "showstickies" option like activity/get and only search & show stickies if showstickies OR !showstickies & pagenumber == 1.
